69/* If not configured otherwise use a minimal partition size of 10M */
70#define DEFAULT_MIN_SIZE (10*1024*1024)
71
72/* Hard lower limit for new partition sizes */
73#define HARD_MIN_SIZE 4096
74
75/* libfdisk takes off slightly more than 1M of the disk size when creating a GPT disk label */
76#define GPT_METADATA_SIZE (1044*1024)
77
78/* LUKS2 takes off 16M of the partition size with its metadata by default */
79#define LUKS2_METADATA_SIZE (16*1024*1024)
80
81/* Note: When growing and placing new partitions we always align to 4K sector size. It's how newer hard disks
82 * are designed, and if everything is aligned to that performance is best. And for older hard disks with 512B
83 * sector size devices were generally assumed to have an even number of sectors, hence at the worst we'll
84 * waste 3K per partition, which is probably fine. */
85
86static enum {
87        EMPTY_REFUSE,   /* refuse empty disks, never create a partition table */
88        EMPTY_ALLOW,    /* allow empty disks, create partition table if necessary */
89        EMPTY_REQUIRE,  /* require an empty disk, create a partition table */
90        EMPTY_FORCE,    /* make disk empty, erase everything, create a partition table always */
91        EMPTY_CREATE,   /* create disk as loopback file, create a partition table always */
92} arg_empty = EMPTY_REFUSE;

180#define PARTITION_EXISTS(p) (!!(p)->current_partition)

218static uint64_t round_down_size(uint64_t v, uint64_t p) {
219        return (v / p) * p;
220}
221
222static uint64_t round_up_size(uint64_t v, uint64_t p) {
223
224        v = DIV_ROUND_UP(v, p);
225
226        if (v > UINT64_MAX / p)
227                return UINT64_MAX; /* overflow */
228
229        return v * p;
230}

232static Partition *partition_new(void) {
233        Partition *p;
234
235        p = new(Partition, 1);
236        if (!p)
237                return NULL;
238
239        *p = (Partition) {
240                .weight = 1000,
241                .padding_weight = 0,
242                .current_size = UINT64_MAX,
243                .new_size = UINT64_MAX,
244                .size_min = UINT64_MAX,
245                .size_max = UINT64_MAX,
246                .current_padding = UINT64_MAX,
247                .new_padding = UINT64_MAX,
248                .padding_min = UINT64_MAX,
249                .padding_max = UINT64_MAX,
250                .partno = UINT64_MAX,
251                .offset = UINT64_MAX,
252                .copy_blocks_fd = -1,
253                .copy_blocks_size = UINT64_MAX,
254                .no_auto = -1,
255                .read_only = -1,
256                .growfs = -1,
257        };
258
259        return p;
260}

262static Partition* partition_free(Partition *p) {
263        if (!p)
264                return NULL;
265
266        free(p->current_label);
267        free(p->new_label);
268        free(p->definition_path);
269
270        if (p->current_partition)
271                fdisk_unref_partition(p->current_partition);
272        if (p->new_partition)
273                fdisk_unref_partition(p->new_partition);
274
275        free(p->copy_blocks_path);
276        safe_close(p->copy_blocks_fd);
277
278        free(p->format);
279        strv_free(p->copy_files);
280        strv_free(p->make_directories);
281
282        return mfree(p);
283}
284
285static Partition* partition_unlink_and_free(Context *context, Partition *p) {
286        if (!p)
287                return NULL;
288
289        LIST_REMOVE(partitions, context->partitions, p);
290
291        assert(context->n_partitions > 0);
292        context->n_partitions--;
293
294        return partition_free(p);
295}
296
297DEFINE_TRIVIAL_CLEANUP_FUNC(Partition*, partition_free);

299static Context *context_new(sd_id128_t seed) {
300        Context *context;
301
302        context = new(Context, 1);
303        if (!context)
304                return NULL;
305
306        *context = (Context) {
307                .start = UINT64_MAX,
308                .end = UINT64_MAX,
309                .total = UINT64_MAX,
310                .seed = seed,
311        };
312
313        return context;
314}
315
316static void context_free_free_areas(Context *context) {
317        assert(context);
318
319        for (size_t i = 0; i < context->n_free_areas; i++)
320                free(context->free_areas[i]);
321
322        context->free_areas = mfree(context->free_areas);
323        context->n_free_areas = 0;
324}
325
326static Context *context_free(Context *context) {
327        if (!context)
328                return NULL;
329
330        while (context->partitions)
331                partition_unlink_and_free(context, context->partitions);
332        assert(context->n_partitions == 0);
333
334        context_free_free_areas(context);
335
336        if (context->fdisk_context)
337                fdisk_unref_context(context->fdisk_context);
338
339        return mfree(context);
340}
341
342DEFINE_TRIVIAL_CLEANUP_FUNC(Context*, context_free);

344static int context_add_free_area(
345                Context *context,
346                uint64_t size,
347                Partition *after) {
348
349        FreeArea *a;
350
351        assert(context);
352        assert(!after || !after->padding_area);
353
354        if (!GREEDY_REALLOC(context->free_areas, context->n_free_areas + 1))
355                return -ENOMEM;
356
357        a = new(FreeArea, 1);
358        if (!a)
359                return -ENOMEM;
360
361        *a = (FreeArea) {
362                .size = size,
363                .after = after,
364        };
365
366        context->free_areas[context->n_free_areas++] = a;
367
368        if (after)
369                after->padding_area = a;
370
371        return 0;
372}
373
374static bool context_drop_one_priority(Context *context) {
375        int32_t priority = 0;
376        bool exists = false;
377
378        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
379                if (p->dropped)
380                        continue;
381                if (p->priority < priority)
382                        continue;
383                if (p->priority == priority) {
384                        exists = exists || PARTITION_EXISTS(p);
385                        continue;
386                }
387
388                priority = p->priority;
389                exists = PARTITION_EXISTS(p);
390        }
391
392        /* Refuse to drop partitions with 0 or negative priorities or partitions of priorities that have at
393         * least one existing priority */
394        if (priority <= 0 || exists)
395                return false;
396
397        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
398                if (p->priority < priority)
399                        continue;
400
401                if (p->dropped)
402                        continue;
403
404                p->dropped = true;
405                log_info("Can't fit partition %s of priority %" PRIi32 ", dropping.", p->definition_path, p->priority);
406        }
407
408        return true;
409}
410
411static uint64_t partition_min_size(Context *context, const Partition *p) {
412        uint64_t sz;
413
414        assert(context);
415        assert(p);
416
417        /* Calculate the disk space we really need at minimum for this partition. If the partition already
418         * exists the current size is what we really need. If it doesn't exist yet refuse to allocate less
419         * than 4K.
420         *
421         * DEFAULT_MIN_SIZE is the default SizeMin= we configure if nothing else is specified. */
422
423        if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p)) {
424                /* Don't allow changing size of partitions not managed by us */
425                assert(p->current_size != UINT64_MAX);
426                return p->current_size;
427        }
428
429        sz = p->current_size != UINT64_MAX ? p->current_size : HARD_MIN_SIZE;
430
431        if (!PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) {
432                uint64_t d = 0;
433
434                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF)
435                        d += round_up_size(LUKS2_METADATA_SIZE, context->grain_size);
436
437                if (p->copy_blocks_size != UINT64_MAX)
438                        d += round_up_size(p->copy_blocks_size, context->grain_size);
439                else if (p->format || p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF) {
440                        uint64_t f;
441
442                        /* If we shall synthesize a file system, take minimal fs size into account (assumed to be 4K if not known) */
443                        f = p->format ? round_up_size(minimal_size_by_fs_name(p->format), context->grain_size) : UINT64_MAX;
444                        d += f == UINT64_MAX ? context->grain_size : f;
445                }
446
447                if (d > sz)
448                        sz = d;
449        }
450
451        return MAX(round_up_size(p->size_min != UINT64_MAX ? p->size_min : DEFAULT_MIN_SIZE, context->grain_size), sz);
452}
453
454static uint64_t partition_max_size(const Context *context, const Partition *p) {
455        uint64_t sm;
456
457        /* Calculate how large the partition may become at max. This is generally the configured maximum
458         * size, except when it already exists and is larger than that. In that case it's the existing size,
459         * since we never want to shrink partitions. */
460
461        assert(context);
462        assert(p);
463
464        if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p)) {
465                /* Don't allow changing size of partitions not managed by us */
466                assert(p->current_size != UINT64_MAX);
467                return p->current_size;
468        }
469
470        sm = round_down_size(p->size_max, context->grain_size);
471
472        if (p->current_size != UINT64_MAX)
473                return MAX(p->current_size, sm);
474
475        return sm;
476}
477
478static uint64_t partition_min_size_with_padding(Context *context, const Partition *p) {
479        uint64_t sz;
480
481        /* Calculate the disk space we need for this partition plus any free space coming after it. This
482         * takes user configured padding into account as well as any additional whitespace needed to align
483         * the next partition to 4K again. */
484
485        assert(context);
486        assert(p);
487
488        sz = partition_min_size(context, p);
489
490        if (p->padding_min != UINT64_MAX)
491                sz += p->padding_min;
492
493        if (PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) {
494                /* If the partition wasn't aligned, add extra space so that any we might add will be aligned */
495                assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
496                return round_up_size(p->offset + sz, context->grain_size) - p->offset;
497        }
498
499        /* If this is a new partition we'll place it aligned, hence we just need to round up the required size here */
500        return round_up_size(sz, context->grain_size);
501}
502
503static uint64_t free_area_available(const FreeArea *a) {
504        assert(a);
505
506        /* Determines how much of this free area is not allocated yet */
507
508        assert(a->size >= a->allocated);
509        return a->size - a->allocated;
510}
511
512static uint64_t free_area_available_for_new_partitions(Context *context, const FreeArea *a) {
513        uint64_t avail;
514
515        assert(context);
516        assert(a);
517
518        /* Similar to free_area_available(), but takes into account that the required size and padding of the
519         * preceding partition is honoured. */
520
521        avail = free_area_available(a);
522        if (a->after) {
523                uint64_t need, space_end, new_end;
524
525                need = partition_min_size_with_padding(context, a->after);
526
527                assert(a->after->offset != UINT64_MAX);
528                assert(a->after->current_size != UINT64_MAX);
529
530                /* Calculate where the free area ends, based on the offset of the partition preceding it */
531                space_end = round_up_size(a->after->offset + a->after->current_size, context->grain_size) + avail;
532
533                /* Calculate where the partition would end when we give it as much as it needs */
534                new_end = round_up_size(a->after->offset + need, context->grain_size);
535
536                /* Calculate saturated difference of the two: that's how much we have free for other partitions */
537                return LESS_BY(space_end, new_end);
538        }
539
540        return avail;
541}
542
543static int free_area_compare(FreeArea *const *a, FreeArea *const*b, Context *context) {
544        assert(context);
545
546        return CMP(free_area_available_for_new_partitions(context, *a),
547                   free_area_available_for_new_partitions(context, *b));
548}
549
550static uint64_t charge_size(Context *context, uint64_t total, uint64_t amount) {
551        assert(context);
552        /* Subtract the specified amount from total, rounding up to multiple of 4K if there's room */
553        assert(amount <= total);
554        return LESS_BY(total, round_up_size(amount, context->grain_size));
555}
556
557static uint64_t charge_weight(uint64_t total, uint64_t amount) {
558        assert(amount <= total);
559        return total - amount;
560}
561
562static bool context_allocate_partitions(Context *context, uint64_t *ret_largest_free_area) {
563        assert(context);
564
565        /* Sort free areas by size, putting smallest first */
566        typesafe_qsort_r(context->free_areas, context->n_free_areas, free_area_compare, context);
567
568        /* In any case return size of the largest free area (i.e. not the size of all free areas
569         * combined!) */
570        if (ret_largest_free_area)
571                *ret_largest_free_area =
572                        context->n_free_areas == 0 ? 0 :
573                        free_area_available_for_new_partitions(context, context->free_areas[context->n_free_areas-1]);
574
575        /* A simple first-fit algorithm. We return true if we can fit the partitions in, otherwise false. */
576        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
577                bool fits = false;
578                uint64_t required;
579                FreeArea *a = NULL;
580
581                /* Skip partitions we already dropped or that already exist */
582                if (p->dropped || PARTITION_EXISTS(p))
583                        continue;
584
585                /* How much do we need to fit? */
586                required = partition_min_size_with_padding(context, p);
587                assert(required % context->grain_size == 0);
588
589                for (size_t i = 0; i < context->n_free_areas; i++) {
590                        a = context->free_areas[i];
591
592                        if (free_area_available_for_new_partitions(context, a) >= required) {
593                                fits = true;
594                                break;
595                        }
596                }
597
598                if (!fits)
599                        return false; /* 😢 Oh no! We can't fit this partition into any free area! */
600
601                /* Assign the partition to this free area */
602                p->allocated_to_area = a;
603
604                /* Budget the minimal partition size */
605                a->allocated += required;
606        }
607
608        return true;
609}
610
611static int context_sum_weights(Context *context, FreeArea *a, uint64_t *ret) {
612        uint64_t weight_sum = 0;
613
614        assert(context);
615        assert(a);
616        assert(ret);
617
618        /* Determine the sum of the weights of all partitions placed in or before the specified free area */
619
620        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
621                if (p->padding_area != a && p->allocated_to_area != a)
622                        continue;
623
624                if (p->weight > UINT64_MAX - weight_sum)
625                        goto overflow_sum;
626                weight_sum += p->weight;
627
628                if (p->padding_weight > UINT64_MAX - weight_sum)
629                        goto overflow_sum;
630                weight_sum += p->padding_weight;
631        }
632
633        *ret = weight_sum;
634        return 0;
635
636overflow_sum:
637        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EOVERFLOW), "Combined weight of partition exceeds unsigned 64bit range, refusing.");
638}
639
640static int scale_by_weight(uint64_t value, uint64_t weight, uint64_t weight_sum, uint64_t *ret) {
641        assert(weight_sum >= weight);
642        assert(ret);
643
644        if (weight == 0) {
645                *ret = 0;
646                return 0;
647        }
648
649        if (value > UINT64_MAX / weight)
650                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EOVERFLOW), "Scaling by weight of partition exceeds unsigned 64bit range, refusing.");
651
652        *ret = value * weight / weight_sum;
653        return 0;
654}
655
656typedef enum GrowPartitionPhase {
657        /* The first phase: we charge partitions which need more (according to constraints) than their weight-based share. */
658        PHASE_OVERCHARGE,
659
660        /* The second phase: we charge partitions which need less (according to constraints) than their weight-based share. */
661        PHASE_UNDERCHARGE,
662
663        /* The third phase: we distribute what remains among the remaining partitions, according to the weights */
664        PHASE_DISTRIBUTE,
665
666        _GROW_PARTITION_PHASE_MAX,
667} GrowPartitionPhase;
668
669static int context_grow_partitions_phase(
670                Context *context,
671                FreeArea *a,
672                GrowPartitionPhase phase,
673                uint64_t *span,
674                uint64_t *weight_sum) {
675
676        int r;
677
678        assert(context);
679        assert(a);
680
681        /* Now let's look at the intended weights and adjust them taking the minimum space assignments into
682         * account. i.e. if a partition has a small weight but a high minimum space value set it should not
683         * get any additional room from the left-overs. Similar, if two partitions have the same weight they
684         * should get the same space if possible, even if one has a smaller minimum size than the other. */
685        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
686
687                /* Look only at partitions associated with this free area, i.e. immediately
688                 * preceding it, or allocated into it */
689                if (p->allocated_to_area != a && p->padding_area != a)
690                        continue;
691
692                if (p->new_size == UINT64_MAX) {
693                        bool charge = false, try_again = false;
694                        uint64_t share, rsz, xsz;
695
696                        /* Calculate how much this space this partition needs if everyone would get
697                         * the weight based share */
698                        r = scale_by_weight(*span, p->weight, *weight_sum, &share);
699                        if (r < 0)
700                                return r;
701
702                        rsz = partition_min_size(context, p);
703                        xsz = partition_max_size(context, p);
704
705                        if (phase == PHASE_OVERCHARGE && rsz > share) {
706                                /* This partition needs more than its calculated share. Let's assign
707                                 * it that, and take this partition out of all calculations and start
708                                 * again. */
709
710                                p->new_size = rsz;
711                                charge = try_again = true;
712
713                        } else if (phase == PHASE_UNDERCHARGE && xsz != UINT64_MAX && xsz < share) {
714                                /* This partition accepts less than its calculated
715                                 * share. Let's assign it that, and take this partition out
716                                 * of all calculations and start again. */
717
718                                p->new_size = xsz;
719                                charge = try_again = true;
720
721                        } else if (phase == PHASE_DISTRIBUTE) {
722                                /* This partition can accept its calculated share. Let's
723                                 * assign it. There's no need to restart things here since
724                                 * assigning this shouldn't impact the shares of the other
725                                 * partitions. */
726
727                                if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p))
728                                        /* Never change of foreign partitions (i.e. those we don't manage) */
729                                        p->new_size = p->current_size;
730                                else
731                                        p->new_size = MAX(round_down_size(share, context->grain_size), rsz);
732
733                                charge = true;
734                        }
735
736                        if (charge) {
737                                *span = charge_size(context, *span, p->new_size);
738                                *weight_sum = charge_weight(*weight_sum, p->weight);
739                        }
740
741                        if (try_again)
742                                return 0; /* try again */
743                }
744
745                if (p->new_padding == UINT64_MAX) {
746                        bool charge = false, try_again = false;
747                        uint64_t share;
748
749                        r = scale_by_weight(*span, p->padding_weight, *weight_sum, &share);
750                        if (r < 0)
751                                return r;
752
753                        if (
 Recommendations (Experimental)  R1: (phase == 123 && p != 123 && p != padding_min)
R2: (phase == 123 && p != 123 && p != padding_min.share)
R3: (phase == PHASE_OVERCHARGE && p != 123 && p > 123)
R4: ((phase == 123) && (p != 123) && (p != padding_min))
R5: (phase->p == PHASE_OVERCHARGE && padding_min->share != 123 && padding_min->share == phase->share)
 Score  Issue:  1 unfamiliar pattern(s) detected 
Cost: 19.50, Total Score: 1019.50
Class: complex_2
phase == PHASE_OVERCHARGE && p->padding_min != UINT64_MAX && p->padding_min > share) {
754                                p->new_padding = p->padding_min;
755                                charge = try_again = true;
756                        } else if (
 Recommendations (Experimental)  R1: (phase == 123 && p != 123 && p < padding_max)
R2: (phase == 123 && p >= 123 && p < padding_max)
R3: (phase->p != PHASE_UNDERCHARGE && phase->p->padding_max != UINT64_MAX && phase->share < phase->p->xx_e)
R4: (phase == 123 && p != 123 && p != padding_max)
R5: (phase == 123 && p != 123 && p != padding_max.share)
 Score  Issue:  1 unfamiliar pattern(s) detected 
Cost: 19.50, Total Score: 1019.50
Class: complex_2
phase == PHASE_UNDERCHARGE && p->padding_max != UINT64_MAX && p->padding_max < share) {
757                                p->new_padding = p->padding_max;
758                                charge = try_again = true;
759                        } else if (phase == PHASE_DISTRIBUTE) {
760
761                                p->new_padding = round_down_size(share, context->grain_size);
762                                if (p->padding_min != UINT64_MAX && p->new_padding < p->padding_min)
763                                        p->new_padding = p->padding_min;
764
765                                charge = true;
766                        }
767
768                        if (charge) {
769                                *span = charge_size(context, *span, p->new_padding);
770                                *weight_sum = charge_weight(*weight_sum, p->padding_weight);
771                        }
772
773                        if (try_again)
774                                return 0; /* try again */
775                }
776        }
777
778        return 1; /* done */
779}
780
781static int context_grow_partitions_on_free_area(Context *context, FreeArea *a) {
782        uint64_t weight_sum = 0, span;
783        int r;
784
785        assert(context);
786        assert(a);
787
788        r = context_sum_weights(context, a, &weight_sum);
789        if (r < 0)
790                return r;
791
792        /* Let's calculate the total area covered by this free area and the partition before it */
793        span = a->size;
794        if (a->after) {
795                assert(a->after->offset != UINT64_MAX);
796                assert(a->after->current_size != UINT64_MAX);
797
798                span += round_up_size(a->after->offset + a->after->current_size, context->grain_size) - a->after->offset;
799        }
800
801        for (GrowPartitionPhase phase = 0; phase < _GROW_PARTITION_PHASE_MAX;) {
802                r = context_grow_partitions_phase(context, a, phase, &span, &weight_sum);
803                if (r < 0)
804                        return r;
805                if (r == 0) /* not done yet, re-run this phase */
806                        continue;
807
808                phase++; /* got to next phase */
809        }
810
811        /* We still have space left over? Donate to preceding partition if we have one */
812        if (span > 0 && a->after && !PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(a->after)) {
813                uint64_t m, xsz;
814
815                assert(a->after->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
816
817                /* Calculate new size and align (but ensure this doesn't shrink the size) */
818                m = MAX(a->after->new_size, round_down_size(a->after->new_size + span, context->grain_size));
819
820                xsz = partition_max_size(context, a->after);
821                if (xsz != UINT64_MAX && m > xsz)
822                        m = xsz;
823
824                span = charge_size(context, span, m - a->after->new_size);
825                a->after->new_size = m;
826        }
827
828        /* What? Even still some space left (maybe because there was no preceding partition, or it had a
829         * size limit), then let's donate it to whoever wants it. */
830        if (span > 0)
831                LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
832                        uint64_t m, xsz;
833
834                        if (p->allocated_to_area != a)
835                                continue;
836
837                        if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p))
838                                continue;
839
840                        assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
841                        m = MAX(p->new_size, round_down_size(p->new_size + span, context->grain_size));
842
843                        xsz = partition_max_size(context, p);
844                        if (xsz != UINT64_MAX && m > xsz)
845                                m = xsz;
846
847                        span = charge_size(context, span, m - p->new_size);
848                        p->new_size = m;
849
850                        if (span == 0)
851                                break;
852                }
853
854        /* Yuck, still no one? Then make it padding */
855        if (span > 0 && a->after) {
856                assert(a->after->new_padding != UINT64_MAX);
857                a->after->new_padding += span;
858        }
859
860        return 0;
861}
862
863static int context_grow_partitions(Context *context) {
864        int r;
865
866        assert(context);
867
868        for (size_t i = 0; i < context->n_free_areas; i++) {
869                r = context_grow_partitions_on_free_area(context, context->free_areas[i]);
870                if (r < 0)
871                        return r;
872        }
873
874        /* All existing partitions that have no free space after them can't change size */
875        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
876                if (p->dropped)
877                        continue;
878
879                if (!PARTITION_EXISTS(p) || p->padding_area) {
880                        /* The algorithm above must have initialized this already */
881                        assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
882                        continue;
883                }
884
885                assert(p->new_size == UINT64_MAX);
886                p->new_size = p->current_size;
887
888                assert(p->new_padding == UINT64_MAX);
889                p->new_padding = p->current_padding;
890        }
891
892        return 0;
893}
894
895static void context_place_partitions(Context *context) {
896        uint64_t partno = 0;
897
898        assert(context);
899
900        /* Determine next partition number to assign */
901        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
902                if (!PARTITION_EXISTS(p))
903                        continue;
904
905                assert(p->partno != UINT64_MAX);
906                if (p->partno >= partno)
907                        partno = p->partno + 1;
908        }
909
910        for (size_t i = 0; i < context->n_free_areas; i++) {
911                FreeArea *a = context->free_areas[i];
912                _unused_ uint64_t left;
913                uint64_t start;
914
915                if (a->after) {
916                        assert(a->after->offset != UINT64_MAX);
917                        assert(a->after->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
918                        assert(a->after->new_padding != UINT64_MAX);
919
920                        start = a->after->offset + a->after->new_size + a->after->new_padding;
921                } else
922                        start = context->start;
923
924                start = round_up_size(start, context->grain_size);
925                left = a->size;
926
927                LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
928                        if (p->allocated_to_area != a)
929                                continue;
930
931                        p->offset = start;
932                        p->partno = partno++;
933
934                        assert(left >= p->new_size);
935                        start += p->new_size;
936                        left -= p->new_size;
937
938                        assert(left >= p->new_padding);
939                        start += p->new_padding;
940                        left -= p->new_padding;
941                }
942        }
943}
944
945static int config_parse_type(
946                const char *unit,
947                const char *filename,
948                unsigned line,
949                const char *section,
950                unsigned section_line,
951                const char *lvalue,
952                int ltype,
953                const char *rvalue,
954                void *data,
955                void *userdata) {
956
957        sd_id128_t *type_uuid = data;
958        int r;
959
960        assert(rvalue);
961        assert(type_uuid);
962
963        r = gpt_partition_type_uuid_from_string(rvalue, type_uuid);
964        if (r < 0)
965                return log_syntax(unit, LOG_ERR, filename, line, r, "Failed to parse partition type: %s", rvalue);
966
967        return 0;
968}
969
970static int config_parse_label(
971                const char *unit,
972                const char *filename,
973                unsigned line,
974                const char *section,
975                unsigned section_line,
976                const char *lvalue,
977                int ltype,
978                const char *rvalue,
979                void *data,
980                void *userdata) {
981
982        _cleanup_free_ char *resolved = NULL;
983        char **label = data;
984        int r;
985
986        assert(rvalue);
987        assert(label);
988
989        /* Nota bene: the empty label is a totally valid one. Let's hence not follow our usual rule of
990         * assigning the empty string to reset to default here, but really accept it as label to set. */
991
992        r = specifier_printf(rvalue, GPT_LABEL_MAX, system_and_tmp_specifier_table, arg_root, NULL, &resolved);
993        if (r < 0) {
994                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
995                           "Failed to expand specifiers in Label=, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
996                return 0;
997        }
998
999        if (!utf8_is_valid(resolved)) {
1000                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, 0,
1001                           "Partition label not valid UTF-8, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
1002                return 0;
1003        }
1004
1005        r = gpt_partition_label_valid(resolved);
1006        if (r < 0) {
1007                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1008                           "Failed to check if string is valid as GPT partition label, ignoring: \"%s\" (from \"%s\")",
1009                           resolved, rvalue);
1010                return 0;
1011        }
1012        if (!r) {
1013                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, 0,
1014                           "Partition label too long for GPT table, ignoring: \"%s\" (from \"%s\")",
1015                           resolved, rvalue);
1016                return 0;
1017        }
1018
1019        free_and_replace(*label, resolved);
1020        return 0;
1021}

1023static int config_parse_weight(
1024                const char *unit,
1025                const char *filename,
1026                unsigned line,
1027                const char *section,
1028                unsigned section_line,
1029                const char *lvalue,
1030                int ltype,
1031                const char *rvalue,
1032                void *data,
1033                void *userdata) {
1034
1035        uint32_t *priority = data, v;
1036        int r;
1037
1038        assert(rvalue);
1039        assert(priority);
1040
1041        r = safe_atou32(rvalue, &v);
1042        if (r < 0) {
1043                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1044                           "Failed to parse weight value, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
1045                return 0;
1046        }
1047
1048        if (v > 1000U*1000U) {
1049                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, 0,
1050                           "Weight needs to be in range 0…10000000, ignoring: %" PRIu32, v);
1051                return 0;
1052        }
1053
1054        *priority = v;
1055        return 0;
1056}

1058static int config_parse_size4096(
1059                const char *unit,
1060                const char *filename,
1061                unsigned line,
1062                const char *section,
1063                unsigned section_line,
1064                const char *lvalue,
1065                int ltype,
1066                const char *rvalue,
1067                void *data,
1068                void *userdata) {
1069
1070        uint64_t *sz = data, parsed;
1071        int r;
1072
1073        assert(rvalue);
1074        assert(data);
1075
1076        r = parse_size(rvalue, 1024, &parsed);
1077        if (r < 0)
1078                return log_syntax(unit, LOG_ERR, filename, line, r,
1079                                  "Failed to parse size value: %s", rvalue);
1080
1081        if (ltype > 0)
1082                *sz = round_up_size(parsed, 4096);
1083        else if (ltype < 0)
1084                *sz = round_down_size(parsed, 4096);
1085        else
1086                *sz = parsed;
1087
1088        if (*sz != parsed)
1089                log_syntax(unit, LOG_NOTICE, filename, line, r, "Rounded %s= size %" PRIu64 " %s %" PRIu64 ", a multiple of 4096.",
1090                           lvalue, parsed, special_glyph(SPECIAL_GLYPH_ARROW_RIGHT), *sz);
1091
1092        return 0;
1093}

1119static int config_parse_copy_files(
1120                const char *unit,
1121                const char *filename,
1122                unsigned line,
1123                const char *section,
1124                unsigned section_line,
1125                const char *lvalue,
1126                int ltype,
1127                const char *rvalue,
1128                void *data,
1129                void *userdata) {
1130
1131        _cleanup_free_ char *source = NULL, *buffer = NULL, *resolved_source = NULL, *resolved_target = NULL;
1132        const char *p = rvalue, *target;
1133        Partition *partition = data;
1134        int r;
1135
1136        assert(rvalue);
1137        assert(partition);
1138
1139        r = extract_first_word(&p, &source, ":", EXTRACT_CUNESCAPE|EXTRACT_DONT_COALESCE_SEPARATORS);
1140        if (r < 0)
1141                return log_syntax(unit, LOG_ERR, filename, line, r, "Failed to extract source path: %s", rvalue);
1142        if (r == 0) {
1143                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, 0, "No argument specified: %s", rvalue);
1144                return 0;
1145        }
1146
1147        r = extract_first_word(&p, &buffer, ":", EXTRACT_CUNESCAPE|EXTRACT_DONT_COALESCE_SEPARATORS);
1148        if (r < 0)
1149                return log_syntax(unit, LOG_ERR, filename, line, r, "Failed to extract target path: %s", rvalue);
1150        if (r == 0)
1151                target = source; /* No target, then it's the same as the source */
1152        else
1153                target = buffer;
1154
1155        if (!isempty(p))
1156                return log_syntax(unit, LOG_ERR, filename, line, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL), "Too many arguments: %s", rvalue);
1157
1158        r = specifier_printf(source, PATH_MAX-1, system_and_tmp_specifier_table, arg_root, NULL, &resolved_source);
1159        if (r < 0) {
1160                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1161                           "Failed to expand specifiers in CopyFiles= source, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
1162                return 0;
1163        }
1164
1165        r = path_simplify_and_warn(resolved_source, PATH_CHECK_ABSOLUTE, unit, filename, line, lvalue);
1166        if (r < 0)
1167                return 0;
1168
1169        r = specifier_printf(target, PATH_MAX-1, system_and_tmp_specifier_table, arg_root, NULL, &resolved_target);
1170        if (r < 0) {
1171                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1172                           "Failed to expand specifiers in CopyFiles= target, ignoring: %s", resolved_target);
1173                return 0;
1174        }
1175
1176        r = path_simplify_and_warn(resolved_target, PATH_CHECK_ABSOLUTE, unit, filename, line, lvalue);
1177        if (r < 0)
1178                return 0;
1179
1180        r = strv_consume_pair(&partition->copy_files, TAKE_PTR(resolved_source), TAKE_PTR(resolved_target));
1181        if (r < 0)
1182                return log_oom();
1183
1184        return 0;
1185}

1187static int config_parse_copy_blocks(
1188                const char *unit,
1189                const char *filename,
1190                unsigned line,
1191                const char *section,
1192                unsigned section_line,
1193                const char *lvalue,
1194                int ltype,
1195                const char *rvalue,
1196                void *data,
1197                void *userdata) {
1198
1199        _cleanup_free_ char *d = NULL;
1200        Partition *partition = data;
1201        int r;
1202
1203        assert(rvalue);
1204        assert(partition);
1205
1206        if (isempty(rvalue)) {
1207                partition->copy_blocks_path = mfree(partition->copy_blocks_path);
1208                partition->copy_blocks_auto = false;
1209                return 0;
1210        }
1211
1212        if (streq(rvalue, "auto")) {
1213                partition->copy_blocks_path = mfree(partition->copy_blocks_path);
1214                partition->copy_blocks_auto = true;
1215                return 0;
1216        }
1217
1218        r = specifier_printf(rvalue, PATH_MAX-1, system_and_tmp_specifier_table, arg_root, NULL, &d);
1219        if (r < 0) {
1220                log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1221                           "Failed to expand specifiers in CopyBlocks= source path, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
1222                return 0;
1223        }
1224
1225        r = path_simplify_and_warn(d, PATH_CHECK_ABSOLUTE, unit, filename, line, lvalue);
1226        if (r < 0)
1227                return 0;
1228
1229        free_and_replace(partition->copy_blocks_path, d);
1230        partition->copy_blocks_auto = false;
1231        return 0;
1232}

1234static int config_parse_make_dirs(
1235                const char *unit,
1236                const char *filename,
1237                unsigned line,
1238                const char *section,
1239                unsigned section_line,
1240                const char *lvalue,
1241                int ltype,
1242                const char *rvalue,
1243                void *data,
1244                void *userdata) {
1245
1246        Partition *partition = data;
1247        const char *p = rvalue;
1248        int r;
1249
1250        assert(rvalue);
1251        assert(partition);
1252
1253        for (;;) {
1254                _cleanup_free_ char *word = NULL, *d = NULL;
1255
1256                r = extract_first_word(&p, &word, NULL, EXTRACT_UNQUOTE);
1257                if (r == -ENOMEM)
1258                        return log_oom();
1259                if (r < 0) {
1260                        log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r, "Invalid syntax, ignoring: %s", rvalue);
1261                        return 0;
1262                }
1263                if (r == 0)
1264                        return 0;
1265
1266                r = specifier_printf(word, PATH_MAX-1, system_and_tmp_specifier_table, arg_root, NULL, &d);
1267                if (r < 0) {
1268                        log_syntax(unit, LOG_WARNING, filename, line, r,
1269                                   "Failed to expand specifiers in MakeDirectories= parameter, ignoring: %s", word);
1270                        continue;
1271                }
1272
1273                r = path_simplify_and_warn(d, PATH_CHECK_ABSOLUTE, unit, filename, line, lvalue);
1274                if (r < 0)
1275                        continue;
1276
1277                r = strv_consume(&partition->make_directories, TAKE_PTR(d));
1278                if (r < 0)
1279                        return log_oom();
1280        }
1281}

1313static int partition_read_definition(Partition *p, const char *path) {
1314
1315        ConfigTableItem table[] = {
1316                { "Partition", "Type",            config_parse_type,        0, &p->type_uuid        },
1317                { "Partition", "Label",           config_parse_label,       0, &p->new_label        },
1318                { "Partition", "UUID",            config_parse_id128,       0, &p->new_uuid         },
1319                { "Partition", "Priority",        config_parse_int32,       0, &p->priority         },
1320                { "Partition", "Weight",          config_parse_weight,      0, &p->weight           },
1321                { "Partition", "PaddingWeight",   config_parse_weight,      0, &p->padding_weight   },
1322                { "Partition", "SizeMinBytes",    config_parse_size4096,    1, &p->size_min         },
1323                { "Partition", "SizeMaxBytes",    config_parse_size4096,   -1, &p->size_max         },
1324                { "Partition", "PaddingMinBytes", config_parse_size4096,    1, &p->padding_min      },
1325                { "Partition", "PaddingMaxBytes", config_parse_size4096,   -1, &p->padding_max      },
1326                { "Partition", "FactoryReset",    config_parse_bool,        0, &p->factory_reset    },
1327                { "Partition", "CopyBlocks",      config_parse_copy_blocks, 0, p                    },
1328                { "Partition", "Format",          config_parse_fstype,      0, &p->format           },
1329                { "Partition", "CopyFiles",       config_parse_copy_files,  0, p                    },
1330                { "Partition", "MakeDirectories", config_parse_make_dirs,   0, p                    },
1331                { "Partition", "Encrypt",         config_parse_encrypt,     0, &p->encrypt          },
1332                { "Partition", "Flags",           config_parse_gpt_flags,   0, &p->gpt_flags        },
1333                { "Partition", "ReadOnly",        config_parse_tristate,    0, &p->read_only        },
1334                { "Partition", "NoAuto",          config_parse_tristate,    0, &p->no_auto          },
1335                { "Partition", "GrowFileSystem",  config_parse_tristate,    0, &p->growfs           },
1336                {}
1337        };
1338        int r;
1339
1340        r = config_parse(NULL, path, NULL,
1341                         "Partition\0",
1342                         config_item_table_lookup, table,
1343                         CONFIG_PARSE_WARN,
1344                         p,
1345                         NULL);
1346        if (r < 0)
1347                return r;
1348
1349        if (p->size_min != UINT64_MAX && p->size_max != UINT64_MAX && p->size_min > p->size_max)
1350                return log_syntax(NULL, LOG_ERR, path, 1, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL),
1351                                  "SizeMinBytes= larger than SizeMaxBytes=, refusing.");
1352
1353        if (p->padding_min != UINT64_MAX && p->padding_max != UINT64_MAX && p->padding_min > p->padding_max)
1354                return log_syntax(NULL, LOG_ERR, path, 1, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL),
1355                                  "PaddingMinBytes= larger than PaddingMaxBytes=, refusing.");
1356
1357        if (sd_id128_is_null(p->type_uuid))
1358                return log_syntax(NULL, LOG_ERR, path, 1, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL),
1359                                  "Type= not defined, refusing.");
1360
1361        if ((p->copy_blocks_path || p->copy_blocks_auto) &&
1362            (p->format || !strv_isempty(p->copy_files) || !strv_isempty(p->make_directories)))
1363                return log_syntax(NULL, LOG_ERR, path, 1, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL),
1364                                  "Format=/CopyFiles=/MakeDirectories= and CopyBlocks= cannot be combined, refusing.");
1365
1366        if ((!strv_isempty(p->copy_files) || !strv_isempty(p->make_directories)) && streq_ptr(p->format, "swap"))
1367                return log_syntax(NULL, LOG_ERR, path, 1, SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL),
1368                                  "Format=swap and CopyFiles= cannot be combined, refusing.");
1369
1370        if (!p->format && (!strv_isempty(p->copy_files) || !strv_isempty(p->make_directories) || (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF && !(p->copy_blocks_path || p->copy_blocks_auto)))) {
1371                /* Pick "ext4" as file system if we are configured to copy files or encrypt the device */
1372                p->format = strdup("ext4");
1373                if (!p->format)
1374                        return log_oom();
1375        }
1376
1377        /* Verity partitions are read only, let's imply the RO flag hence, unless explicitly configured otherwise. */
1378        if ((gpt_partition_type_is_root_verity(p->type_uuid) ||
1379             gpt_partition_type_is_usr_verity(p->type_uuid)) &&
1380            p->read_only < 0)
1381                p->read_only = true;
1382
1383        /* Default to "growfs" on, unless read-only */
1384        if (gpt_partition_type_knows_growfs(p->type_uuid) &&
1385            p->read_only <= 0)
1386                p->growfs = true;
1387
1388        return 0;
1389}
1390
1391static int context_read_definitions(
1392                Context *context,
1393                const char *directory,
1394                const char *root) {
1395
1396        _cleanup_strv_free_ char **files = NULL;
1397        Partition *last = NULL;
1398        int r;
1399
1400        assert(context);
1401
1402        if (directory)
1403                r = conf_files_list_strv(&files, ".conf", NULL, CONF_FILES_REGULAR|CONF_FILES_FILTER_MASKED, (const char**) STRV_MAKE(directory));
1404        else
1405                r = conf_files_list_strv(&files, ".conf", root, CONF_FILES_REGULAR|CONF_FILES_FILTER_MASKED, (const char**) CONF_PATHS_STRV("repart.d"));
1406        if (r < 0)
1407                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to enumerate *.conf files: %m");
1408
1409        STRV_FOREACH(f, files) {
1410                _cleanup_(partition_freep) Partition *p = NULL;
1411
1412                p = partition_new();
1413                if (!p)
1414                        return log_oom();
1415
1416                p->definition_path = strdup(*f);
1417                if (!p->definition_path)
1418                        return log_oom();
1419
1420                r = partition_read_definition(p, *f);
1421                if (r < 0)
1422                        return r;
1423
1424                LIST_INSERT_AFTER(partitions, context->partitions, last, p);
1425                last = TAKE_PTR(p);
1426                context->n_partitions++;
1427        }
1428
1429        return 0;
1430}
1431
1432static int determine_current_padding(
1433                struct fdisk_context *c,
1434                struct fdisk_table *t,
1435                struct fdisk_partition *p,
1436                uint64_t secsz,
1437                uint64_t grainsz,
1438                uint64_t *ret) {
1439
1440        size_t n_partitions;
1441        uint64_t offset, next = UINT64_MAX;
1442
1443        assert(c);
1444        assert(t);
1445        assert(p);
1446
1447        if (!fdisk_partition_has_end(p))
1448                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Partition has no end!");
1449
1450        offset = fdisk_partition_get_end(p);
1451        assert(offset < UINT64_MAX / secsz);
1452        offset *= secsz;
1453
1454        n_partitions = fdisk_table_get_nents(t);
1455        for (size_t i = 0; i < n_partitions; i++)  {
1456                struct fdisk_partition *q;
1457                uint64_t start;
1458
1459                q = fdisk_table_get_partition(t, i);
1460                if (!q)
1461                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Failed to read partition metadata: %m");
1462
1463                if (fdisk_partition_is_used(q) <= 0)
1464                        continue;
1465
1466                if (!fdisk_partition_has_start(q))
1467                        continue;
1468
1469                start = fdisk_partition_get_start(q);
1470                assert(start < UINT64_MAX / secsz);
1471                start *= secsz;
1472
1473                if (
 Recommendations (Experimental)  R1: (start > offset && (next == 123 || next > start))
R2: (start == offset && (next == 123 || next > xx_d))
R3: (start <= offset && (next == 123 || next == start))
R4: (start >= offset && (next == 123 || start <= next))
R5: (start == offset && (next == "string" || next == xx_d))
 Score  Issue:  1 unfamiliar pattern(s) detected 
Cost: 12.75, Total Score: 1012.75
Class: complex_2
start >= offset && (next == UINT64_MAX || next > start))
1474                        next = start;
1475        }
1476
1477        if (next == UINT64_MAX) {
1478                /* No later partition? In that case check the end of the usable area */
1479                next = fdisk_get_last_lba(c);
1480                assert(next < UINT64_MAX);
1481                next++; /* The last LBA is one sector before the end */
1482
1483                assert(next < UINT64_MAX / secsz);
1484                next *= secsz;
1485
1486                if (offset > next)
1487                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Partition end beyond disk end.");
1488        }
1489
1490        assert(next >= offset);
1491        offset = round_up_size(offset, grainsz);
1492        next = round_down_size(next, grainsz);
1493
1494        *ret = LESS_BY(next, offset); /* Saturated subtraction, rounding might have fucked things up */
1495        return 0;
1496}

1498static int fdisk_ask_cb(struct fdisk_context *c, struct fdisk_ask *ask, void *data) {
1499        _cleanup_free_ char *ids = NULL;
1500        int r;
1501
1502        if (fdisk_ask_get_type(ask) != FDISK_ASKTYPE_STRING)
1503                return -EINVAL;
1504
1505        ids = new(char, SD_ID128_UUID_STRING_MAX);
1506        if (!ids)
1507                return -ENOMEM;
1508
1509        r = fdisk_ask_string_set_result(ask, sd_id128_to_uuid_string(*(sd_id128_t*) data, ids));
1510        if (r < 0)
1511                return r;
1512
1513        TAKE_PTR(ids);
1514        return 0;
1515}

1517static int fdisk_set_disklabel_id_by_uuid(struct fdisk_context *c, sd_id128_t id) {
1518        int r;
1519
1520        r = fdisk_set_ask(c, fdisk_ask_cb, &id);
1521        if (r < 0)
1522                return r;
1523
1524        r = fdisk_set_disklabel_id(c);
1525        if (r < 0)
1526                return r;
1527
1528        return fdisk_set_ask(c, NULL, NULL);
1529}
1530
1531static int derive_uuid(sd_id128_t base, const char *token, sd_id128_t *ret) {
1532        union {
1533                uint8_t md[SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE];
1534                sd_id128_t id;
1535        } result;
1536
1537        assert(token);
1538        assert(ret);
1539
1540        /* Derive a new UUID from the specified UUID in a stable and reasonably safe way. Specifically, we
1541         * calculate the HMAC-SHA256 of the specified token string, keyed by the supplied base (typically the
1542         * machine ID). We use the machine ID as key (and not as cleartext!) of the HMAC operation since it's
1543         * the machine ID we don't want to leak. */
1544
1545        hmac_sha256(base.bytes, sizeof(base.bytes), token, strlen(token), result.md);
1546
1547        /* Take the first half, mark it as v4 UUID */
1548        assert_cc(sizeof(result.md) == sizeof(result.id) * 2);
1549        *ret = id128_make_v4_uuid(result.id);
1550        return 0;
1551}
1552
1553static int context_load_partition_table(
1554                Context *context,
1555                const char *node,
1556                int *backing_fd) {
1557
1558        _cleanup_(fdisk_unref_contextp) struct fdisk_context *c = NULL;
1559        _cleanup_(fdisk_unref_tablep) struct fdisk_table *t = NULL;
1560        uint64_t left_boundary = UINT64_MAX, first_lba, last_lba, nsectors;
1561        _cleanup_free_ char *disk_uuid_string = NULL;
1562        bool from_scratch = false;
1563        sd_id128_t disk_uuid;
1564        size_t n_partitions;
1565        unsigned long secsz;
1566        uint64_t grainsz;
1567        int r;
1568
1569        assert(context);
1570        assert(node);
1571        assert(backing_fd);
1572        assert(!context->fdisk_context);
1573        assert(!context->free_areas);
1574        assert(context->start == UINT64_MAX);
1575        assert(context->end == UINT64_MAX);
1576        assert(context->total == UINT64_MAX);
1577
1578        c = fdisk_new_context();
1579        if (!c)
1580                return log_oom();
1581
1582        /* libfdisk doesn't have an API to operate on arbitrary fds, hence reopen the fd going via the
1583         * /proc/self/fd/ magic path if we have an existing fd. Open the original file otherwise. */
1584        if (*backing_fd < 0)
1585                r = fdisk_assign_device(c, node, arg_dry_run);
1586        else
1587                r = fdisk_assign_device(c, FORMAT_PROC_FD_PATH(*backing_fd), arg_dry_run);
1588        if (r == -EINVAL && arg_size_auto) {
1589                struct stat st;
1590
1591                /* libfdisk returns EINVAL if opening a file of size zero. Let's check for that, and accept
1592                 * it if automatic sizing is requested. */
1593
1594                if (*backing_fd < 0)
1595                        r = stat(node, &st);
1596                else
1597                        r = fstat(*backing_fd, &st);
1598                if (r < 0)
1599                        return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to stat block device '%s': %m", node);
1600
1601                if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode) && st.st_size == 0) {
1602                        /* User the fallback values if we have no better idea */
1603                        context->sector_size = 512;
1604                        context->grain_size = 4096;
1605                        return /* from_scratch = */ true;
1606                }
1607
1608                r = -EINVAL;
1609        }
1610        if (r < 0)
1611                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to open device '%s': %m", node);
1612
1613        if (*backing_fd < 0) {
1614                /* If we have no fd referencing the device yet, make a copy of the fd now, so that we have one */
1615                *backing_fd = fcntl(fdisk_get_devfd(c), F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC, 3);
1616                if (*backing_fd < 0)
1617                        return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to duplicate fdisk fd: %m");
1618        }
1619
1620        /* Tell udev not to interfere while we are processing the device */
1621        if (flock(fdisk_get_devfd(c), arg_dry_run ? LOCK_SH : LOCK_EX) < 0)
1622                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to lock block device: %m");
1623
1624        /* The offsets/sizes libfdisk returns to us will be in multiple of the sector size of the
1625         * device. This is typically 512, and sometimes 4096. Let's query libfdisk once for it, and then use
1626         * it for all our needs. Note that the values we use ourselves always are in bytes though, thus mean
1627         * the same thing universally. Also note that regardless what kind of sector size is in use we'll
1628         * place partitions at multiples of 4K. */
1629        secsz = fdisk_get_sector_size(c);
1630
1631        /* Insist on a power of two, and that it's a multiple of 512, i.e. the traditional sector size. */
1632        if (secsz < 512 || 
 Recommendations (Experimental)  R1: (xx_secsz < 512 || secsz != (1UL << log2u64(secsz)))
R2: (xx_secsz < 512 || secsz == (1UL << log2u64(secsz)))
R3: (xx_secsz < 512 || secsz == 1UL << log2u64())
R4: (xx_secsz < 512 || secsz >= (1UL << log2u64(512, {const})))
R5: (xx_secsz < 512 || secsz & (1UL << log2u64(xx_c)))
 Score  Issue:  1 unfamiliar pattern(s) detected 
Cost: 26.00, Total Score: 1026.00
Class: complex_max
secsz != 1UL << log2u64(secsz))
1633                return log_error_errno(errno, "Sector size %lu is not a power of two larger than 512? Refusing.", secsz);
1634
1635        /* Use at least 4K, and ensure it's a multiple of the sector size, regardless if that is smaller or
1636         * larger */
1637        grainsz = secsz < 4096 ? 4096 : secsz;
1638
1639        log_debug("Sector size of device is %lu bytes. Using grain size of %" PRIu64 ".", secsz, grainsz);
1640
1641        switch (arg_empty) {
1642
1643        case EMPTY_REFUSE:
1644                /* Refuse empty disks, insist on an existing GPT partition table */
1645                if (!fdisk_is_labeltype(c, FDISK_DISKLABEL_GPT))
1646                        return log_notice_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EHWPOISON), "Disk %s has no GPT disk label, not repartitioning.", node);
1647
1648                break;
1649
1650        case EMPTY_REQUIRE:
1651                /* Require an empty disk, refuse any existing partition table */
1652                r = fdisk_has_label(c);
1653                if (r < 0)
1654                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to determine whether disk %s has a disk label: %m", node);
1655                if (r > 0)
1656                        return log_notice_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EHWPOISON), "Disk %s already has a disk label, refusing.", node);
1657
1658                from_scratch = true;
1659                break;
1660
1661        case EMPTY_ALLOW:
1662                /* Allow both an empty disk and an existing partition table, but only GPT */
1663                r = fdisk_has_label(c);
1664                if (r < 0)
1665                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to determine whether disk %s has a disk label: %m", node);
1666                if (r > 0) {
1667                        if (!fdisk_is_labeltype(c, FDISK_DISKLABEL_GPT))
1668                                return log_notice_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EHWPOISON), "Disk %s has non-GPT disk label, not repartitioning.", node);
1669                } else
1670                        from_scratch = true;
1671
1672                break;
1673
1674        case EMPTY_FORCE:
1675        case EMPTY_CREATE:
1676                /* Always reinitiaize the disk, don't consider what there was on the disk before */
1677                from_scratch = true;
1678                break;
1679        }
1680
1681        if (from_scratch) {

1683                if (r < 0)
1684                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create GPT disk label: %m");

1687                if (r < 0)

1689

1691                if (r < 0)
1692                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set GPT disk label: %m");

1695        }
1696
1697        r = fdisk_get_disklabel_id(c, &disk_uuid_string);
1698        if (r < 0)
1699                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to get current GPT disk label UUID: %m");
1700
1701        r = sd_id128_from_string(disk_uuid_string, &disk_uuid);
1702        if (r < 0)

1705        if (sd_id128_is_null(disk_uuid)) {
1706                r = derive_uuid(context->seed, "disk-uuid", &disk_uuid);
1707                if (r < 0)
1708                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to acquire disk GPT uuid: %m");
1709
1710                r = fdisk_set_disklabel_id(c);
1711                if (r < 0)
1712                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set GPT disk label: %m");
1713        }
1714
1715        r = fdisk_get_partitions(c, &t);
1716        if (r < 0)
1717                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to acquire partition table: %m");

1729                size_t partno;

1807                                        if (r < 0)

1810

1812                                break;

1814                }

1847        }

1849add_initial_free_area:
1850        nsectors = fdisk_get_nsectors(c);
1851        assert(nsectors <= UINT64_MAX/secsz);

1853
1854        first_lba = fdisk_get_first_lba(c);
1855        assert(first_lba <= UINT64_MAX/secsz);
1856        first_lba *= secsz;
1857
1858        last_lba = fdisk_get_last_lba(c);
1859        assert(last_lba < UINT64_MAX);
1860        last_lba++;
1861        assert(last_lba <= UINT64_MAX/secsz);
1862        last_lba *= secsz;
1863
1864        assert(last_lba >= first_lba);
1865
1866        if (left_boundary == UINT64_MAX) {
1867                /* No partitions at all? Then the whole disk is up for grabs. */
1868
1869                first_lba = round_up_size(first_lba, grainsz);
1870                last_lba = round_down_size(last_lba, grainsz);
1871
1872                if (last_lba > first_lba) {
1873                        r = context_add_free_area(context, last_lba - first_lba, NULL);
1874                        if (r < 0)
1875                                return r;
1876                }
1877        } else {
1878                /* Add space left of first partition */
1879                assert(left_boundary >= first_lba);
1880
1881                first_lba = round_up_size(first_lba, grainsz);
1882                left_boundary = round_down_size(left_boundary, grainsz);
1883                last_lba = round_down_size(last_lba, grainsz);
1884
1885                if (left_boundary > first_lba) {
1886                        r = context_add_free_area(context, left_boundary - first_lba, NULL);
1887                        if (r < 0)
1888                                return r;
1889                }
1890        }
1891
1892        context->start = first_lba;
1893        context->end = last_lba;
1894        context->total = nsectors;
1895        context->sector_size = secsz;
1896        context->grain_size = grainsz;
1897        context->fdisk_context = TAKE_PTR(c);
1898
1899        return from_scratch;
1900}
1901
1902static void context_unload_partition_table(Context *context) {
1903        assert(context);
1904
1905        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
1906
1907                /* Entirely remove partitions that have no configuration */
1908                if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p)) {
1909                        partition_unlink_and_free(context, p);
1910                        continue;
1911                }
1912
1913                /* Otherwise drop all data we read off the block device and everything we might have
1914                 * calculated based on it */
1915
1916                p->dropped = false;
1917                p->current_size = UINT64_MAX;
1918                p->new_size = UINT64_MAX;
1919                p->current_padding = UINT64_MAX;
1920                p->new_padding = UINT64_MAX;
1921                p->partno = UINT64_MAX;
1922                p->offset = UINT64_MAX;
1923
1924                if (p->current_partition) {
1925                        fdisk_unref_partition(p->current_partition);
1926                        p->current_partition = NULL;
1927                }
1928
1929                if (p->new_partition) {
1930                        fdisk_unref_partition(p->new_partition);
1931                        p->new_partition = NULL;
1932                }
1933
1934                p->padding_area = NULL;
1935                p->allocated_to_area = NULL;
1936
1937                p->current_uuid = SD_ID128_NULL;
1938                p->current_label = mfree(p->current_label);
1939        }
1940
1941        context->start = UINT64_MAX;
1942        context->end = UINT64_MAX;
1943        context->total = UINT64_MAX;
1944
1945        if (context->fdisk_context) {
1946                fdisk_unref_context(context->fdisk_context);
1947                context->fdisk_context = NULL;
1948        }
1949
1950        context_free_free_areas(context);
1951}

1953static int format_size_change(uint64_t from, uint64_t to, char **ret) {
1954        char *t;
1955
1956        if (from != UINT64_MAX) {
1957                if (from == to || to == UINT64_MAX)
1958                        t = strdup(FORMAT_BYTES(from));
1959                else
1960                        t = strjoin(FORMAT_BYTES(from), " ", special_glyph(SPECIAL_GLYPH_ARROW_RIGHT), " ", FORMAT_BYTES(to));
1961        } else if (to != UINT64_MAX)
1962                t = strjoin(special_glyph(SPECIAL_GLYPH_ARROW_RIGHT), " ", FORMAT_BYTES(to));
1963        else {
1964                *ret = NULL;
1965                return 0;
1966        }
1967
1968        if (!t)
1969                return log_oom();
1970
1971        *ret = t;
1972        return 1;
1973}

1982                return p->current_label;
1983
1984        return gpt_partition_type_uuid_to_string(p->type_uuid);

2094static void context_bar_char_process_partition(
2095                Context *context,
2096                Partition *bar[],
2097                size_t n,
2098                Partition *p,
2099                size_t *ret_start) {
2100
2101        uint64_t from, to, total;
2102        size_t x, y;
2103
2104        assert(context);
2105        assert(bar);
2106        assert(n > 0);
2107        assert(p);
2108
2109        if (p->dropped)
2110                return;
2111
2112        assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
2113        assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
2114
2115        from = p->offset;
2116        to = from + p->new_size;
2117
2118        assert(context->total > 0);
2119        total = context->total;
2120
2121        assert(from <= total);
2122        x = from * n / total;
2123
2124        assert(to <= total);
2125        y = to * n / total;
2126
2127        assert(x <= y);
2128        assert(y <= n);
2129
2130        for (size_t i = x; i < y; i++)
2131                bar[i] = p;
2132
2133        *ret_start = x;
2134}

2136static int partition_hint(const Partition *p, const char *node, char **ret) {
2137        _cleanup_free_ char *buf = NULL;
2138        const char *label;
2139        sd_id128_t id;
2140
2141        /* Tries really hard to find a suitable description for this partition */
2142
2143        if (p->definition_path) {
2144                buf = strdup(basename(p->definition_path));
2145                goto done;
2146        }
2147
2148        label = partition_label(p);
2149        if (!isempty(label)) {
2150                buf = strdup(label);
2151                goto done;
2152        }
2153
2154        if (p->partno != UINT64_MAX) {
2155                buf = fdisk_partname(node, p->partno+1);
2156                goto done;
2157        }
2158
2159        if (!sd_id128_is_null(p->new_uuid))
2160                id = p->new_uuid;
2161        else if (!sd_id128_is_null(p->current_uuid))
2162                id = p->current_uuid;
2163        else
2164                id = p->type_uuid;
2165
2166        buf = strdup(SD_ID128_TO_UUID_STRING(id));
2167
2168done:
2169        if (!buf)
2170                return -ENOMEM;
2171
2172        *ret = TAKE_PTR(buf);
2173        return 0;
2174}

2306static int context_wipe_range(Context *context, uint64_t offset, uint64_t size) {
2307        _cleanup_(blkid_free_probep) blkid_probe probe = NULL;
2308        int r;
2309
