2311        assert(offset != UINT64_MAX);
2312        assert(size != UINT64_MAX);
2313
2314        probe = blkid_new_probe();
2315        if (!probe)
2316                return log_oom();
2317
2318        errno = 0;
2319        r = blkid_probe_set_device(probe, fdisk_get_devfd(context->fdisk_context), offset, size);
2320        if (r < 0)
2321                return log_error_errno(errno ?: SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Failed to allocate device probe for wiping.");
2322
2323        errno = 0;
2324        if (blkid_probe_enable_superblocks(probe, true) < 0 ||
2325            blkid_probe_set_superblocks_flags(probe, BLKID_SUBLKS_MAGIC|BLKID_SUBLKS_BADCSUM) < 0 ||
2326            blkid_probe_enable_partitions(probe, true) < 0 ||
2327            blkid_probe_set_partitions_flags(probe, BLKID_PARTS_MAGIC) < 0)
2328                return log_error_errno(errno ?: SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Failed to enable superblock and partition probing.");
2329
2330        for (;;) {
2331                errno = 0;
2332                r = blkid_do_probe(probe);
2333                if (r < 0)
2334                        return log_error_errno(errno ?: SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Failed to probe for file systems.");
2335                if (r > 0)
2336                        break;
2337
2338                errno = 0;
2339                if (blkid_do_wipe(probe, false) < 0)
2340                        return log_error_errno(errno ?: SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Failed to wipe file system signature.");
2341        }
2342
2343        return 0;
2344}
2345
2346static int context_wipe_partition(Context *context, Partition *p) {
2347        int r;
2348
2349        assert(context);
2350        assert(p);
2351        assert(!PARTITION_EXISTS(p)); /* Safety check: never wipe existing partitions */
2352
2353        assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
2354        assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
2355
2356        r = context_wipe_range(context, p->offset, p->new_size);
2357        if (r < 0)
2358                return r;
2359
2360        log_info("Successfully wiped file system signatures from future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2361        return 0;
2362}
2363
2364static int context_discard_range(
2365                Context *context,
2366                uint64_t offset,
2367                uint64_t size) {
2368
2369        struct stat st;
2370        int fd;
2371
2372        assert(context);
2373        assert(offset != UINT64_MAX);
2374        assert(size != UINT64_MAX);
2375
2376        if (size <= 0)
2377                return 0;
2378
2379        assert_se((fd = fdisk_get_devfd(context->fdisk_context)) >= 0);
2380
2381        if (fstat(fd, &st) < 0)
2382                return -errno;
2383
2384        if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {
2385                if (fallocate(fd, FALLOC_FL_PUNCH_HOLE|FALLOC_FL_KEEP_SIZE, offset, size) < 0) {
2386                        if (ERRNO_IS_NOT_SUPPORTED(errno))
2387                                return -EOPNOTSUPP;
2388
2389                        return -errno;
2390                }
2391
2392                return 1;
2393        }
2394
2395        if (S_ISBLK(st.st_mode)) {
2396                uint64_t range[2], end;
2397
2398                range[0] = round_up_size(offset, context->sector_size);
2399
2400                if (offset > UINT64_MAX - size)
2401                        return -ERANGE;
2402
2403                end = offset + size;
2404                if (end <= range[0])
2405                        return 0;
2406
2407                range[1] = round_down_size(end - range[0], context->sector_size);
2408                if (range[1] <= 0)
2409                        return 0;
2410
2411                if (ioctl(fd, BLKDISCARD, range) < 0) {
2412                        if (ERRNO_IS_NOT_SUPPORTED(errno))
2413                                return -EOPNOTSUPP;
2414
2415                        return -errno;
2416                }
2417
2418                return 1;
2419        }
2420
2421        return -EOPNOTSUPP;
2422}
2423
2424static int context_discard_partition(Context *context, Partition *p) {
2425        int r;
2426
2427        assert(context);
2428        assert(p);
2429
2430        assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
2431        assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
2432        assert(!PARTITION_EXISTS(p)); /* Safety check: never discard existing partitions */
2433
2434        if (!arg_discard)
2435                return 0;
2436
2437        r = context_discard_range(context, p->offset, p->new_size);
2438        if (r == -EOPNOTSUPP) {
2439                log_info("Storage does not support discard, not discarding data in future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2440                return 0;
2441        }
2442        if (r == -EBUSY) {
2443                /* Let's handle this gracefully: https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=211167 */
2444                log_info("Block device is busy, not discarding partition %" PRIu64 " because it probably is mounted.", p->partno);
2445                return 0;
2446        }
2447        if (r == 0) {
2448                log_info("Partition %" PRIu64 " too short for discard, skipping.", p->partno);
2449                return 0;
2450        }
2451        if (r < 0)
2452                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to discard data for future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2453
2454        log_info("Successfully discarded data from future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2455        return 1;
2456}
2457
2458static int context_discard_gap_after(Context *context, Partition *p) {
2459        uint64_t gap, next = UINT64_MAX;
2460        int r;
2461
2462        assert(context);
2463        assert(!p || (p->offset != UINT64_MAX && p->new_size != UINT64_MAX));
2464
2465        if (p)
2466                gap = p->offset + p->new_size;
2467        else
2468                gap = context->start;
2469
2470        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, q, context->partitions) {
2471                if (q->dropped)
2472                        continue;
2473
2474                assert(q->offset != UINT64_MAX);
2475                assert(q->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
2476
2477                if (q->offset < gap)
2478                        continue;
2479
2480                if (next == UINT64_MAX || q->offset < next)
2481                        next = q->offset;
2482        }
2483
2484        if (next == UINT64_MAX) {
2485                next = context->end;
2486                if (gap > next)
2487                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EIO), "Partition end beyond disk end.");
2488        }
2489
2490        assert(next >= gap);
2491        r = context_discard_range(context, gap, next - gap);
2492        if (r == -EOPNOTSUPP) {
2493                if (p)
2494                        log_info("Storage does not support discard, not discarding gap after partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2495                else
2496                        log_info("Storage does not support discard, not discarding gap at beginning of disk.");
2497                return 0;
2498        }
2499        if (r == 0)  /* Too short */
2500                return 0;
2501        if (r < 0) {
2502                if (p)
2503                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to discard gap after partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2504                else
2505                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to discard gap at beginning of disk.");
2506        }
2507
2508        if (p)
2509                log_info("Successfully discarded gap after partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2510        else
2511                log_info("Successfully discarded gap at beginning of disk.");
2512
2513        return 0;
2514}
2515
2516static int context_wipe_and_discard(Context *context, bool from_scratch) {
2517        int r;
2518
2519        assert(context);
2520
2521        /* Wipe and discard the contents of all partitions we are about to create. We skip the discarding if
2522         * we were supposed to start from scratch anyway, as in that case we just discard the whole block
2523         * device in one go early on. */
2524
2525        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
2526
2527                if (!p->allocated_to_area)
2528                        continue;
2529
2530                r = context_wipe_partition(context, p);
2531                if (r < 0)
2532                        return r;
2533
2534                if (!from_scratch) {
2535                        r = context_discard_partition(context, p);
2536                        if (r < 0)
2537                                return r;
2538
2539                        r = context_discard_gap_after(context, p);
2540                        if (r < 0)
2541                                return r;
2542                }
2543        }
2544
2545        if (!from_scratch) {
2546                r = context_discard_gap_after(context, NULL);
2547                if (r < 0)
2548                        return r;
2549        }
2550
2551        return 0;
2552}
2553
2554static int partition_encrypt(
2555                Context *context,
2556                Partition *p,
2557                const char *node,
2558                struct crypt_device **ret_cd,
2559                char **ret_volume,
2560                int *ret_fd) {
2561#if HAVE_LIBCRYPTSETUP
2562        _cleanup_(sym_crypt_freep) struct crypt_device *cd = NULL;
2563        _cleanup_(erase_and_freep) void *volume_key = NULL;
2564        _cleanup_free_ char *dm_name = NULL, *vol = NULL;
2565        size_t volume_key_size = 256 / 8;
2566        sd_id128_t uuid;
2567        int r;
2568
2569        assert(context);
2570        assert(p);
2571        assert(p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF);
2572
2573        log_debug("Encryption mode for partition %" PRIu64 ": %s", p->partno, encrypt_mode_to_string(p->encrypt));
2574
2575        r = dlopen_cryptsetup();
2576        if (r < 0)
2577                return log_error_errno(r, "libcryptsetup not found, cannot encrypt: %m");
2578
2579        if (asprintf(&dm_name, "luks-repart-%08" PRIx64, random_u64()) < 0)
2580                return log_oom();
2581
2582        if (ret_volume) {
2583                vol = path_join("/dev/mapper/", dm_name);
2584                if (!vol)
2585                        return log_oom();
2586        }
2587
2588        r = derive_uuid(p->new_uuid, "luks-uuid", &uuid);
2589        if (r < 0)
2590                return r;
2591
2592        log_info("Encrypting future partition %" PRIu64 "...", p->partno);
2593
2594        volume_key = malloc(volume_key_size);
2595        if (!volume_key)
2596                return log_oom();
2597
2598        r = crypto_random_bytes(volume_key, volume_key_size);
2599        if (r < 0)
2600                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to generate volume key: %m");
2601
2602        r = sym_crypt_init(&cd, node);
2603        if (r < 0)
2604                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to allocate libcryptsetup context: %m");
2605
2606        cryptsetup_enable_logging(cd);
2607
2608        r = sym_crypt_format(cd,
2609                         CRYPT_LUKS2,
2610                         "aes",
2611                         "xts-plain64",
2612                         SD_ID128_TO_UUID_STRING(uuid),
2613                         volume_key,
2614                         volume_key_size,
2615                         &(struct crypt_params_luks2) {
2616                                 .label = strempty(p->new_label),
2617                                 .sector_size = context->sector_size,
2618                         });
2619        if (r < 0)
2620                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to LUKS2 format future partition: %m");
2621
2622        if (IN_SET(p->encrypt, ENCRYPT_KEY_FILE, ENCRYPT_KEY_FILE_TPM2)) {
2623                r = sym_crypt_keyslot_add_by_volume_key(
2624                                cd,
2625                                CRYPT_ANY_SLOT,
2626                                volume_key,
2627                                volume_key_size,
2628                                strempty(arg_key),
2629                                arg_key_size);
2630                if (r < 0)
2631                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to add LUKS2 key: %m");
2632        }
2633
2634        if (IN_SET(p->encrypt, ENCRYPT_TPM2, ENCRYPT_KEY_FILE_TPM2)) {
2635#if HAVE_TPM2
2636                _cleanup_(erase_and_freep) char *base64_encoded = NULL;
2637                _cleanup_(json_variant_unrefp) JsonVariant *v = NULL;
2638                _cleanup_(erase_and_freep) void *secret = NULL;
2639                _cleanup_free_ void *blob = NULL, *hash = NULL;
2640                size_t secret_size, blob_size, hash_size;
2641                uint16_t pcr_bank, primary_alg;
2642                int keyslot;
2643
2644                r = tpm2_seal(arg_tpm2_device, arg_tpm2_pcr_mask, NULL, &secret, &secret_size, &blob, &blob_size, &hash, &hash_size, &pcr_bank, &primary_alg);
2645                if (r < 0)
2646                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to seal to TPM2: %m");
2647
2648                r = base64mem(secret, secret_size, &base64_encoded);
2649                if (r < 0)
2650                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to base64 encode secret key: %m");
2651
2652                r = cryptsetup_set_minimal_pbkdf(cd);
2653                if (r < 0)
2654                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set minimal PBKDF: %m");
2655
2656                keyslot = sym_crypt_keyslot_add_by_volume_key(
2657                                cd,
2658                                CRYPT_ANY_SLOT,
2659                                volume_key,
2660                                volume_key_size,
2661                                base64_encoded,
2662                                strlen(base64_encoded));
2663                if (keyslot < 0)
2664                        return log_error_errno(keyslot, "Failed to add new TPM2 key to %s: %m", node);
2665
2666                r = tpm2_make_luks2_json(keyslot, arg_tpm2_pcr_mask, pcr_bank, primary_alg, blob, blob_size, hash, hash_size, 0, &v);
2667                if (r < 0)
2668                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to prepare TPM2 JSON token object: %m");
2669
2670                r = cryptsetup_add_token_json(cd, v);
2671                if (r < 0)
2672                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to add TPM2 JSON token to LUKS2 header: %m");
2673#else
2674                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EOPNOTSUPP),
2675                                       "Support for TPM2 enrollment not enabled.");
2676#endif
2677        }
2678
2679        r = sym_crypt_activate_by_volume_key(
2680                        cd,
2681                        dm_name,
2682                        volume_key,
2683                        volume_key_size,
2684                        arg_discard ? CRYPT_ACTIVATE_ALLOW_DISCARDS : 0);
2685        if (r < 0)
2686                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to activate LUKS superblock: %m");
2687
2688        log_info("Successfully encrypted future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
2689
2690        if (ret_fd) {
2691                _cleanup_close_ int dev_fd = -1;
2692
2693                dev_fd = open(vol, O_RDWR|O_CLOEXEC|O_NOCTTY);
2694                if (dev_fd < 0)
2695                        return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to open LUKS volume '%s': %m", vol);
2696
2697                *ret_fd = TAKE_FD(dev_fd);
2698        }
2699
2700        if (ret_cd)
2701                *ret_cd = TAKE_PTR(cd);
2702        if (ret_volume)
2703                *ret_volume = TAKE_PTR(vol);
2704
2705        return 0;
2706#else
2707        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EOPNOTSUPP), "libcryptsetup is not supported, cannot encrypt: %m");
2708#endif
2709}
2710
2711static int deactivate_luks(struct crypt_device *cd, const char *node) {
2712#if HAVE_LIBCRYPTSETUP
2713        int r;
2714
2715        if (!cd)
2716                return 0;
2717
2718        assert(node);
2719
2720        /* udev or so might access out block device in the background while we are done. Let's hence force
2721         * detach the volume. We sync'ed before, hence this should be safe. */
2722
2723        r = sym_crypt_deactivate_by_name(cd, basename(node), CRYPT_DEACTIVATE_FORCE);
2724        if (r < 0)
2725                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to deactivate LUKS device: %m");
2726
2727        return 1;
2728#else
2729        return 0;
2730#endif
2731}
2732
2733static int context_copy_blocks(Context *context) {
2734        int whole_fd = -1, r;
2735
2736        assert(context);
2737
2738        /* Copy in file systems on the block level */
2739
2740        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
2741                _cleanup_(sym_crypt_freep) struct crypt_device *cd = NULL;
2742                _cleanup_(loop_device_unrefp) LoopDevice *d = NULL;
2743                _cleanup_free_ char *encrypted = NULL;
2744                _cleanup_close_ int encrypted_dev_fd = -1;
2745                int target_fd;
2746
2747                if (p->copy_blocks_fd < 0)
2748                        continue;
2749
2750                if (p->dropped)
2751                        continue;
2752
2753                if (PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) /* Never copy over existing partitions */
2754                        continue;
2755
2756                assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
2757                assert(p->copy_blocks_size != UINT64_MAX);
2758                assert(p->new_size >= p->copy_blocks_size);
2759
2760                if (whole_fd < 0)
2761                        assert_se((whole_fd = fdisk_get_devfd(context->fdisk_context)) >= 0);
2762
2763                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF) {
2764                        r = loop_device_make(whole_fd, O_RDWR, p->offset, p->new_size, 0, &d);
2765                        if (r < 0)
2766                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to make loopback device of future partition %" PRIu64 ": %m", p->partno);
2767
2768                        r = loop_device_flock(d, LOCK_EX);
2769                        if (r < 0)
2770                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to lock loopback device: %m");
2771
2772                        r = partition_encrypt(context, p, d->node, &cd, &encrypted, &encrypted_dev_fd);
2773                        if (r < 0)
2774                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to encrypt device: %m");
2775
2776                        if (flock(encrypted_dev_fd, LOCK_EX) < 0)
2777                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to lock LUKS device: %m");
2778
2779                        target_fd = encrypted_dev_fd;
2780                }  else {
2781                        if (lseek(whole_fd, p->offset, SEEK_SET) == (off_t) -1)
2782                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to seek to partition offset: %m");
2783
2784                        target_fd = whole_fd;
2785                }
2786
2787                log_info("Copying in '%s' (%s) on block level into future partition %" PRIu64 ".",
2788                         p->copy_blocks_path, FORMAT_BYTES(p->copy_blocks_size), p->partno);
2789
2790                r = copy_bytes_full(p->copy_blocks_fd, target_fd, p->copy_blocks_size, 0, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
2791                if (r < 0)
2792                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to copy in data from '%s': %m", p->copy_blocks_path);
2793
2794                if (fsync(target_fd) < 0)
2795                        return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to synchronize copied data blocks: %m");
2796
2797                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF) {
2798                        encrypted_dev_fd = safe_close(encrypted_dev_fd);
2799
2800                        r = deactivate_luks(cd, encrypted);
2801                        if (r < 0)
2802                                return r;
2803
2804                        sym_crypt_free(cd);
2805                        cd = NULL;
2806
2807                        r = loop_device_sync(d);
2808                        if (r < 0)
2809                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to sync loopback device: %m");
2810                }
2811
2812                log_info("Copying in of '%s' on block level completed.", p->copy_blocks_path);
2813        }
2814
2815        return 0;
2816}
2817
2818static int do_copy_files(Partition *p, const char *fs) {
2819        int r;
2820
2821        assert(p);
2822        assert(fs);
2823
2824        STRV_FOREACH_PAIR(source, target, p->copy_files) {
2825                _cleanup_close_ int sfd = -1, pfd = -1, tfd = -1;
2826
2827                sfd = chase_symlinks_and_open(*source, arg_root, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT|CHASE_WARN, O_CLOEXEC|O_NOCTTY, NULL);
2828                if (sfd < 0)
2829                        return log_error_errno(sfd, "Failed to open source file '%s%s': %m", strempty(arg_root), *source);
2830
2831                r = fd_verify_regular(sfd);
2832                if (r < 0) {
2833                        if (r != -EISDIR)
2834                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to check type of source file '%s': %m", *source);
2835
2836                        /* We are looking at a directory */
2837                        tfd = chase_symlinks_and_open(*target, fs, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT|CHASE_WARN, O_RDONLY|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC, NULL);
2838                        if (tfd < 0) {
2839                                _cleanup_free_ char *dn = NULL, *fn = NULL;
2840
2841                                if (tfd != -ENOENT)
2842                                        return log_error_errno(tfd, "Failed to open target directory '%s': %m", *target);
2843
2844                                r = path_extract_filename(*target, &fn);
2845                                if (r < 0)
2846                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to extract filename from '%s': %m", *target);
2847
2848                                r = path_extract_directory(*target, &dn);
2849                                if (r < 0)
2850                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to extract directory from '%s': %m", *target);
2851
2852                                r = mkdir_p_root(fs, dn, UID_INVALID, GID_INVALID, 0755);
2853                                if (r < 0)
2854                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create parent directory '%s': %m", dn);
2855
2856                                pfd = chase_symlinks_and_open(dn, fs, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT|CHASE_WARN, O_RDONLY|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC, NULL);
2857                                if (pfd < 0)
2858                                        return log_error_errno(pfd, "Failed to open parent directory of target: %m");
2859
2860                                r = copy_tree_at(
2861                                                sfd, ".",
2862                                                pfd, fn,
2863                                                UID_INVALID, GID_INVALID,
2864                                                COPY_REFLINK|COPY_MERGE|COPY_REPLACE|COPY_SIGINT|COPY_HARDLINKS|COPY_ALL_XATTRS);
2865                        } else
2866                                r = copy_tree_at(
2867                                                sfd, ".",
2868                                                tfd, ".",
2869                                                UID_INVALID, GID_INVALID,
2870                                                COPY_REFLINK|COPY_MERGE|COPY_REPLACE|COPY_SIGINT|COPY_HARDLINKS|COPY_ALL_XATTRS);
2871                        if (r < 0)
2872                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to copy '%s' to '%s%s': %m", *source, strempty(arg_root), *target);
2873                } else {
2874                        _cleanup_free_ char *dn = NULL, *fn = NULL;
2875
2876                        /* We are looking at a regular file */
2877
2878                        r = path_extract_filename(*target, &fn);
2879                        if (r == -EADDRNOTAVAIL || r == O_DIRECTORY)
2880                                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EISDIR),
2881                                                       "Target path '%s' refers to a directory, but source path '%s' refers to regular file, can't copy.", *target, *source);
2882                        if (r < 0)
2883                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to extract filename from '%s': %m", *target);
2884
2885                        r = path_extract_directory(*target, &dn);
2886                        if (r < 0)
2887                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to extract directory from '%s': %m", *target);
2888
2889                        r = mkdir_p_root(fs, dn, UID_INVALID, GID_INVALID, 0755);
2890                        if (r < 0)
2891                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create parent directory: %m");
2892
2893                        pfd = chase_symlinks_and_open(dn, fs, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT|CHASE_WARN, O_RDONLY|O_DIRECTORY|O_CLOEXEC, NULL);
2894                        if (pfd < 0)
2895                                return log_error_errno(pfd, "Failed to open parent directory of target: %m");
2896
2897                        tfd = openat(pfd, fn, O_CREAT|O_EXCL|O_WRONLY|O_CLOEXEC, 0700);
2898                        if (tfd < 0)
2899                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to create target file '%s': %m", *target);
2900
2901                        r = copy_bytes(sfd, tfd, UINT64_MAX, COPY_REFLINK|COPY_SIGINT);
2902                        if (r < 0)
2903                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to copy '%s' to '%s%s': %m", *source, strempty(arg_root), *target);
2904
2905                        (void) copy_xattr(sfd, tfd, COPY_ALL_XATTRS);
2906                        (void) copy_access(sfd, tfd);
2907                        (void) copy_times(sfd, tfd, 0);
2908                }
2909        }
2910
2911        return 0;
2912}

2914static int do_make_directories(Partition *p, const char *fs) {

2918        assert(fs);

2920        STRV_FOREACH(d, p->make_directories) {
2921
2922                r = mkdir_p_root(fs, *d, UID_INVALID, GID_INVALID, 0755);
2923                if (r < 0)
2924                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create directory '%s' in file system: %m", *d);

2930static int partition_populate(Partition *p, const char *node) {
2931        int r;
2932
2933        assert(p);
2934        assert(node);
2935
2936        if (strv_isempty(p->copy_files) && strv_isempty(p->make_directories))
2937                return 0;
2938
2939        log_info("Populating partition %" PRIu64 " with files.", p->partno);
2940
2941        /* We copy in a child process, since we have to mount the fs for that, and we don't want that fs to
2942         * appear in the host namespace. Hence we fork a child that has its own file system namespace and
2943         * detached mount propagation. */
2944
2945        r = safe_fork("(sd-copy)", FORK_DEATHSIG|FORK_LOG|FORK_WAIT|FORK_NEW_MOUNTNS|FORK_MOUNTNS_SLAVE, NULL);
2946        if (r < 0)
2947                return r;
2948        if (r == 0) {
2949                static const char fs[] = "/run/systemd/mount-root";
2950                /* This is a child process with its own mount namespace and propagation to host turned off */
2951
2952                r = mkdir_p(fs, 0700);
2953                if (r < 0) {
2954                        log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create mount point: %m");
2955                        _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
2956                }
2957
2958                if (mount_nofollow_verbose(LOG_ERR, node, fs, p->format, MS_NOATIME|MS_NODEV|MS_NOEXEC|MS_NOSUID, NULL) < 0)
2959                        _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
2960
2961                if (do_copy_files(p, fs) < 0)
2962                        _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
2963
2964                if (do_make_directories(p, fs) < 0)
2965                        _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
2966
2967                r = syncfs_path(AT_FDCWD, fs);
2968                if (r < 0) {
2969                        log_error_errno(r, "Failed to synchronize written files: %m");
2970                        _exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
2971                }
2972
2973                _exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
2974        }
2975
2976        log_info("Successfully populated partition %" PRIu64 " with files.", p->partno);
2977        return 0;
2978}
2979
2980static int context_mkfs(Context *context) {
2981        int fd = -1, r;
2982
2983        assert(context);
2984
2985        /* Make a file system */
2986
2987        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
2988                _cleanup_(sym_crypt_freep) struct crypt_device *cd = NULL;
2989                _cleanup_(loop_device_unrefp) LoopDevice *d = NULL;
2990                _cleanup_free_ char *encrypted = NULL;
2991                _cleanup_close_ int encrypted_dev_fd = -1;
2992                const char *fsdev;
2993                sd_id128_t fs_uuid;
2994
2995                if (p->dropped)
2996                        continue;
2997
2998                if (PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) /* Never format existing partitions */
2999                        continue;
3000
3001                if (!p->format)
3002                        continue;
3003
3004                assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
3005                assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
3006
3007                if (fd < 0)
3008                        assert_se((fd = fdisk_get_devfd(context->fdisk_context)) >= 0);
3009
3010                /* Loopback block devices are not only useful to turn regular files into block devices, but
3011                 * also to cut out sections of block devices into new block devices. */
3012
3013                r = loop_device_make(fd, O_RDWR, p->offset, p->new_size, 0, &d);
3014                if (r < 0)
3015                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to make loopback device of future partition %" PRIu64 ": %m", p->partno);
3016
3017                r = loop_device_flock(d, LOCK_EX);
3018                if (r < 0)
3019                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to lock loopback device: %m");
3020
3021                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF) {
3022                        r = partition_encrypt(context, p, d->node, &cd, &encrypted, &encrypted_dev_fd);
3023                        if (r < 0)
3024                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to encrypt device: %m");
3025
3026                        if (flock(encrypted_dev_fd, LOCK_EX) < 0)
3027                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to lock LUKS device: %m");
3028
3029                        fsdev = encrypted;
3030                } else
3031                        fsdev = d->node;
3032
3033                log_info("Formatting future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
3034
3035                /* Calculate the UUID for the file system as HMAC-SHA256 of the string "file-system-uuid",
3036                 * keyed off the partition UUID. */
3037                r = derive_uuid(p->new_uuid, "file-system-uuid", &fs_uuid);
3038                if (r < 0)
3039                        return r;
3040
3041                r = make_filesystem(fsdev, p->format, strempty(p->new_label), fs_uuid, arg_discard);
3042                if (r < 0) {
3043                        encrypted_dev_fd = safe_close(encrypted_dev_fd);
3044                        (void) deactivate_luks(cd, encrypted);
3045                        return r;
3046                }
3047
3048                log_info("Successfully formatted future partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
3049
3050                /* The file system is now created, no need to delay udev further */
3051                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF)
3052                        if (flock(encrypted_dev_fd, LOCK_UN) < 0)
3053                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to unlock LUKS device: %m");
3054
3055                r = partition_populate(p, fsdev);
3056                if (r < 0) {
3057                        encrypted_dev_fd = safe_close(encrypted_dev_fd);
3058                        (void) deactivate_luks(cd, encrypted);
3059                        return r;
3060                }
3061
3062                /* Note that we always sync explicitly here, since mkfs.fat doesn't do that on its own, and
3063                 * if we don't sync before detaching a block device the in-flight sectors possibly won't hit
3064                 * the disk. */
3065
3066                if (p->encrypt != ENCRYPT_OFF) {
3067                        if (fsync(encrypted_dev_fd) < 0)
3068                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to synchronize LUKS volume: %m");
3069                        encrypted_dev_fd = safe_close(encrypted_dev_fd);
3070
3071                        r = deactivate_luks(cd, encrypted);
3072                        if (r < 0)
3073                                return r;
3074
3075                        sym_crypt_free(cd);
3076                        cd = NULL;
3077                }
3078
3079                r = loop_device_sync(d);
3080                if (r < 0)
3081                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to sync loopback device: %m");
3082        }
3083
3084        return 0;
3085}
3086
3087static int partition_acquire_uuid(Context *context, Partition *p, sd_id128_t *ret) {
3088        struct {
3089                sd_id128_t type_uuid;
3090                uint64_t counter;
3091        } _packed_  plaintext = {};
3092        union {
3093                uint8_t md[SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE];
3094                sd_id128_t id;
3095        } result;
3096
3097        uint64_t k = 0;
3098        int r;
3099
3100        assert(context);
3101        assert(p);
3102        assert(ret);
3103
3104        /* Calculate a good UUID for the indicated partition. We want a certain degree of reproducibility,
3105         * hence we won't generate the UUIDs randomly. Instead we use a cryptographic hash (precisely:
3106         * HMAC-SHA256) to derive them from a single seed. The seed is generally the machine ID of the
3107         * installation we are processing, but if random behaviour is desired can be random, too. We use the
3108         * seed value as key for the HMAC (since the machine ID is something we generally don't want to leak)
3109         * and the partition type as plaintext. The partition type is suffixed with a counter (only for the
3110         * second and later partition of the same type) if we have more than one partition of the same
3111         * time. Or in other words:
3112         *
3113         * With:
3114         *     SEED := /etc/machine-id
3115         *
3116         * If first partition instance of type TYPE_UUID:
3117         *     PARTITION_UUID := HMAC-SHA256(SEED, TYPE_UUID)
3118         *
3119         * For all later partition instances of type TYPE_UUID with INSTANCE being the LE64 encoded instance number:
3120         *     PARTITION_UUID := HMAC-SHA256(SEED, TYPE_UUID || INSTANCE)
3121         */
3122
3123        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, q, context->partitions) {
3124                if (p == q)
3125                        break;
3126
3127                if (!sd_id128_equal(p->type_uuid, q->type_uuid))
3128                        continue;
3129
3130                k++;
3131        }
3132
3133        plaintext.type_uuid = p->type_uuid;
3134        plaintext.counter = htole64(k);
3135
3136        hmac_sha256(context->seed.bytes, sizeof(context->seed.bytes),
3137                    &plaintext,
3138                    k == 0 ? sizeof(sd_id128_t) : sizeof(plaintext),
3139                    result.md);
3140
3141        /* Take the first half, mark it as v4 UUID */
3142        assert_cc(sizeof(result.md) == sizeof(result.id) * 2);
3143        result.id = id128_make_v4_uuid(result.id);
3144
3145        /* Ensure this partition UUID is actually unique, and there's no remaining partition from an earlier run? */
3146        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, q, context->partitions) {
3147                if (p == q)
3148                        continue;
3149
3150                if (sd_id128_in_set(result.id, q->current_uuid, q->new_uuid)) {
3151                        log_warning("Partition UUID calculated from seed for partition %" PRIu64 " already used, reverting to randomized UUID.", p->partno);
3152
3153                        r = sd_id128_randomize(&result.id);
3154                        if (r < 0)
3155                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to generate randomized UUID: %m");
3156
3157                        break;
3158                }
3159        }
3160
3161        *ret = result.id;
3162        return 0;
3163}
3164
3165static int partition_acquire_label(Context *context, Partition *p, char **ret) {
3166        _cleanup_free_ char *label = NULL;
3167        const char *prefix;
3168        unsigned k = 1;
3169
3170        assert(context);
3171        assert(p);
3172        assert(ret);
3173
3174        prefix = gpt_partition_type_uuid_to_string(p->type_uuid);
3175        if (!prefix)
3176                prefix = "linux";
3177
3178        for (;;) {
3179                const char *ll = label ?: prefix;
3180                bool retry = false;
3181
3182                LIST_FOREACH(partitions, q, context->partitions) {
3183                        if (p == q)
3184                                break;
3185
3186                        if (streq_ptr(ll, q->current_label) ||
3187                            streq_ptr(ll, q->new_label)) {
3188                                retry = true;
3189                                break;
3190                        }
3191                }
3192
3193                if (!retry)
3194                        break;
3195
3196                label = mfree(label);
3197                if (asprintf(&label, "%s-%u", prefix, ++k) < 0)
3198                        return log_oom();
3199        }
3200
3201        if (!label) {
3202                label = strdup(prefix);
3203                if (!label)
3204                        return log_oom();
3205        }
3206
3207        *ret = TAKE_PTR(label);
3208        return 0;
3209}
3210
3211static int context_acquire_partition_uuids_and_labels(Context *context) {
3212        int r;
3213
3214        assert(context);
3215
3216        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
3217                /* Never touch foreign partitions */
3218                if (PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p)) {
3219                        p->new_uuid = p->current_uuid;
3220
3221                        if (p->current_label) {
3222                                r = free_and_strdup_warn(&p->new_label, strempty(p->current_label));
3223                                if (r < 0)
3224                                        return r;
3225                        }
3226
3227                        continue;
3228                }
3229
3230                if (!sd_id128_is_null(p->current_uuid))
3231                        p->new_uuid = p->current_uuid; /* Never change initialized UUIDs */
3232                else if (sd_id128_is_null(p->new_uuid)) {
3233                        /* Not explicitly set by user! */
3234                        r = partition_acquire_uuid(context, p, &p->new_uuid);
3235                        if (r < 0)
3236                                return r;
3237                }
3238
3239                if (!isempty(p->current_label)) {
3240                        /* never change initialized labels */
3241                        r = free_and_strdup_warn(&p->new_label, p->current_label);
3242                        if (r < 0)
3243                                return r;
3244                } else if (!p->new_label) {
3245                        /* Not explicitly set by user! */
3246
3247                        r = partition_acquire_label(context, p, &p->new_label);
3248                        if (r < 0)
3249                                return r;
3250                }
3251        }
3252
3253        return 0;
3254}
3255
3256static int set_gpt_flags(struct fdisk_partition *q, uint64_t flags) {
3257        _cleanup_free_ char *a = NULL;
3258
3259        for (unsigned i = 0; i < sizeof(flags) * 8; i++) {
3260                uint64_t bit = UINT64_C(1) << i;
3261                char buf[DECIMAL_STR_MAX(unsigned)+1];
3262
3263                if (!FLAGS_SET(flags, bit))
3264                        continue;
3265
3266                xsprintf(buf, "%u", i);
3267                if (!strextend_with_separator(&a, ",", buf))
3268                        return -ENOMEM;
3269        }
3270
3271        return fdisk_partition_set_attrs(q, a);
3272}

3274static uint64_t partition_merge_flags(Partition *p) {
3275        uint64_t f;
3276
3277        assert(p);
3278
3279        f = p->gpt_flags;
3280
3281        if (p->no_auto >= 0) {
3282                if (gpt_partition_type_knows_no_auto(p->type_uuid))
3283                        SET_FLAG(f, GPT_FLAG_NO_AUTO, p->no_auto);
3284                else {
3285                        char buffer[SD_ID128_UUID_STRING_MAX];
3286                        log_warning("Configured NoAuto=%s for partition type '%s' that doesn't support it, ignoring.",
3287                                    yes_no(p->no_auto),
3288                                    gpt_partition_type_uuid_to_string_harder(p->type_uuid, buffer));
3289                }
3290        }
3291
3292        if (p->read_only >= 0) {
3293                if (gpt_partition_type_knows_read_only(p->type_uuid))
3294                        SET_FLAG(f, GPT_FLAG_READ_ONLY, p->read_only);
3295                else {
3296                        char buffer[SD_ID128_UUID_STRING_MAX];
3297                        log_warning("Configured ReadOnly=%s for partition type '%s' that doesn't support it, ignoring.",
3298                                    yes_no(p->read_only),
3299                                    gpt_partition_type_uuid_to_string_harder(p->type_uuid, buffer));
3300                }
3301        }
3302
3303        if (p->growfs >= 0) {
3304                if (gpt_partition_type_knows_growfs(p->type_uuid))
3305                        SET_FLAG(f, GPT_FLAG_GROWFS, p->growfs);
3306                else {
3307                        char buffer[SD_ID128_UUID_STRING_MAX];
3308                        log_warning("Configured GrowFileSystem=%s for partition type '%s' that doesn't support it, ignoring.",
3309                                    yes_no(p->growfs),
3310                                    gpt_partition_type_uuid_to_string_harder(p->type_uuid, buffer));
3311                }
3312        }
3313
3314        return f;
3315}
3316
3317static int context_mangle_partitions(Context *context) {
3318        int r;
3319
3320        assert(context);
3321
3322        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
3323                if (p->dropped)
3324                        continue;
3325
3326                assert(p->new_size != UINT64_MAX);
3327                assert(p->offset != UINT64_MAX);
3328                assert(p->partno != UINT64_MAX);
3329
3330                if (PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) {
3331                        bool changed = false;
3332
3333                        assert(p->current_partition);
3334
3335                        if (p->new_size != p->current_size) {
3336                                assert(p->new_size >= p->current_size);
3337                                assert(p->new_size % context->sector_size == 0);
3338
3339                                r = fdisk_partition_size_explicit(p->current_partition, true);
3340                                if (r < 0)
3341                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to enable explicit sizing: %m");
3342
3343                                r = fdisk_partition_set_size(p->current_partition, p->new_size / context->sector_size);
3344                                if (r < 0)
3345                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to grow partition: %m");
3346
3347                                log_info("Growing existing partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
3348                                changed = true;
3349                        }
3350
3351                        if (!sd_id128_equal(p->new_uuid, p->current_uuid)) {
3352                                assert(!sd_id128_is_null(p->new_uuid));
3353
3354                                r = fdisk_partition_set_uuid(p->current_partition, SD_ID128_TO_UUID_STRING(p->new_uuid));
3355                                if (r < 0)
3356                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition UUID: %m");
3357
3358                                log_info("Initializing UUID of existing partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
3359                                changed = true;
3360                        }
3361
3362                        if (!streq_ptr(p->new_label, p->current_label)) {
3363                                r = fdisk_partition_set_name(p->current_partition, strempty(p->new_label));
3364                                if (r < 0)
3365                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition label: %m");
3366
3367                                log_info("Setting partition label of existing partition %" PRIu64 ".", p->partno);
3368                                changed = true;
3369                        }
3370
3371                        if (changed) {
3372                                assert(!PARTITION_IS_FOREIGN(p)); /* never touch foreign partitions */
3373
3374                                r = fdisk_set_partition(context->fdisk_context, p->partno, p->current_partition);
3375                                if (r < 0)
3376                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to update partition: %m");
3377                        }
3378                } else {
3379                        _cleanup_(fdisk_unref_partitionp) struct fdisk_partition *q = NULL;
3380                        _cleanup_(fdisk_unref_parttypep) struct fdisk_parttype *t = NULL;
3381
3382                        assert(!p->new_partition);
3383                        assert(p->offset % context->sector_size == 0);
3384                        assert(p->new_size % context->sector_size == 0);
3385                        assert(!sd_id128_is_null(p->new_uuid));
3386                        assert(p->new_label);
3387
3388                        t = fdisk_new_parttype();
3389                        if (!t)
3390                                return log_oom();
3391
3392                        r = fdisk_parttype_set_typestr(t, SD_ID128_TO_UUID_STRING(p->type_uuid));
3393                        if (r < 0)
3394                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to initialize partition type: %m");
3395
3396                        q = fdisk_new_partition();
3397                        if (!q)
3398                                return log_oom();
3399
3400                        r = fdisk_partition_set_type(q, t);
3401                        if (r < 0)
3402                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition type: %m");
3403
3404                        r = fdisk_partition_size_explicit(q, true);
3405                        if (r < 0)
3406                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to enable explicit sizing: %m");
3407
3408                        r = fdisk_partition_set_start(q, p->offset / context->sector_size);
3409                        if (r < 0)
3410                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to position partition: %m");
3411
3412                        r = fdisk_partition_set_size(q, p->new_size / context->sector_size);
3413                        if (r < 0)
3414                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to grow partition: %m");
3415
3416                        r = fdisk_partition_set_partno(q, p->partno);
3417                        if (r < 0)
3418                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition number: %m");
3419
3420                        r = fdisk_partition_set_uuid(q, SD_ID128_TO_UUID_STRING(p->new_uuid));
3421                        if (r < 0)
3422                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition UUID: %m");
3423
3424                        r = fdisk_partition_set_name(q, strempty(p->new_label));
3425                        if (r < 0)
3426                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set partition label: %m");
3427
3428                        /* Merge the no auto + read only + growfs setting with the literal flags, and set them for the partition */
3429                        r = set_gpt_flags(q, partition_merge_flags(p));
3430                        if (r < 0)
3431                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to set GPT partition flags: %m");
3432
3433                        log_info("Adding new partition %" PRIu64 " to partition table.", p->partno);
3434
3435                        r = fdisk_add_partition(context->fdisk_context, q, NULL);
3436                        if (r < 0)
3437                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to add partition: %m");
3438
3439                        assert(!p->new_partition);
3440                        p->new_partition = TAKE_PTR(q);
3441                }
3442        }
3443
3444        return 0;
3445}
3446
3447static int context_write_partition_table(
3448                Context *context,
3449                const char *node,
3450                bool from_scratch) {
3451
3452        _cleanup_(fdisk_unref_tablep) struct fdisk_table *original_table = NULL;
3453        int capable, r;
3454
3455        assert(context);
3456
3457        if (arg_pretty > 0 ||
3458            (arg_pretty < 0 && isatty(STDOUT_FILENO) > 0) ||
3459            !FLAGS_SET(arg_json_format_flags, JSON_FORMAT_OFF)) {
3460
3461                (void) context_dump_partitions(context, node);
3462
3463                putc('\n', stdout);
3464
3465                if (arg_json_format_flags & JSON_FORMAT_OFF)
3466                        (void) context_dump_partition_bar(context, node);
3467                putc('\n', stdout);
3468                fflush(stdout);
3469        }
3470
3471        if (!from_scratch && !context_changed(context)) {
3472                log_info("No changes.");
3473                return 0;
3474        }
3475
3476        if (arg_dry_run) {
3477                log_notice("Refusing to repartition, please re-run with --dry-run=no.");
3478                return 0;
3479        }
3480
3481        log_info("Applying changes.");
3482
3483        if (from_scratch) {
3484                r = context_wipe_range(context, 0, context->total);
3485                if (r < 0)
3486                        return r;
3487
3488                log_info("Wiped block device.");
3489
3490                r = context_discard_range(context, 0, context->total);
3491                if (r == -EOPNOTSUPP)
3492                        log_info("Storage does not support discard, not discarding entire block device data.");
3493                else if (r < 0)
3494                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to discard entire block device: %m");
3495                else if (r > 0)
3496                        log_info("Discarded entire block device.");
3497        }
3498
3499        r = fdisk_get_partitions(context->fdisk_context, &original_table);
3500        if (r < 0)
3501                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to acquire partition table: %m");
3502
3503        /* Wipe fs signatures and discard sectors where the new partitions are going to be placed and in the
3504         * gaps between partitions, just to be sure. */
3505        r = context_wipe_and_discard(context, from_scratch);
3506        if (r < 0)
3507                return r;
3508
3509        r = context_copy_blocks(context);
3510        if (r < 0)
3511                return r;
3512
3513        r = context_mkfs(context);
3514        if (r < 0)
3515                return r;
3516
3517        r = context_mangle_partitions(context);
3518        if (r < 0)
3519                return r;
3520
3521        log_info("Writing new partition table.");
3522
3523        r = fdisk_write_disklabel(context->fdisk_context);
3524        if (r < 0)
3525                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to write partition table: %m");
3526
3527        capable = blockdev_partscan_enabled(fdisk_get_devfd(context->fdisk_context));
3528        if (capable == -ENOTBLK)
3529                log_debug("Not telling kernel to reread partition table, since we are not operating on a block device.");
3530        else if (capable < 0)
3531                return log_error_errno(capable, "Failed to check if block device supports partition scanning: %m");
3532        else if (capable > 0) {
3533                log_info("Telling kernel to reread partition table.");
3534
3535                if (from_scratch)
3536                        r = fdisk_reread_partition_table(context->fdisk_context);
3537                else
3538                        r = fdisk_reread_changes(context->fdisk_context, original_table);
3539                if (r < 0)
3540                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to reread partition table: %m");
3541        } else
3542                log_notice("Not telling kernel to reread partition table, because selected image does not support kernel partition block devices.");
3543
3544        log_info("All done.");
3545
3546        return 0;
3547}

3549static int context_read_seed(Context *context, const char *root) {
3550        int r;
3551
3552        assert(context);
3553
3554        if (!sd_id128_is_null(context->seed))
3555                return 0;
3556
3557        if (!arg_randomize) {
3558                _cleanup_close_ int fd = -1;
3559
3560                fd = chase_symlinks_and_open("/etc/machine-id", root, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC, NULL);
3561                if (fd == -ENOENT)
3562                        log_info("No machine ID set, using randomized partition UUIDs.");
3563                else if (fd < 0)
3564                        return log_error_errno(fd, "Failed to determine machine ID of image: %m");
3565                else {
3566                        r = id128_read_fd(fd, ID128_PLAIN_OR_UNINIT, &context->seed);
3567                        if (r == -ENOMEDIUM)
3568                                log_info("No machine ID set, using randomized partition UUIDs.");
3569                        else if (r < 0)
3570                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to parse machine ID of image: %m");
3571
3572                        return 0;
3573                }
3574        }
3575
3576        r = sd_id128_randomize(&context->seed);
3577        if (r < 0)
3578                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to generate randomized seed: %m");
3579
3580        return 0;
3581}
3582
3583static int context_factory_reset(Context *context, bool from_scratch) {
3584        size_t n = 0;
3585        int r;
3586
3587        assert(context);
3588
3589        if (arg_factory_reset <= 0)
3590                return 0;
3591
3592        if (from_scratch) /* Nothing to reset if we start from scratch */
3593                return 0;
3594
3595        if (arg_dry_run) {
3596                log_notice("Refusing to factory reset, please re-run with --dry-run=no.");
3597                return 0;
3598        }
3599
3600        log_info("Applying factory reset.");
3601
3602        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
3603
3604                if (!p->factory_reset || !PARTITION_EXISTS(p))
3605                        continue;
3606
3607                assert(p->partno != UINT64_MAX);
3608
3609                log_info("Removing partition %" PRIu64 " for factory reset.", p->partno);
3610
3611                r = fdisk_delete_partition(context->fdisk_context, p->partno);
3612                if (r < 0)
3613                        return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to remove partition %" PRIu64 ": %m", p->partno);
3614
3615                n++;
3616        }
3617
3618        if (n == 0) {
3619                log_info("Factory reset requested, but no partitions to delete found.");
3620                return 0;
3621        }
3622
3623        r = fdisk_write_disklabel(context->fdisk_context);
3624        if (r < 0)
3625                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to write disk label: %m");
3626
3627        log_info("Successfully deleted %zu partitions.", n);
3628        return 1;
3629}
3630
3631static int context_can_factory_reset(Context *context) {
3632        assert(context);
3633
3634        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions)
3635                if (p->factory_reset && PARTITION_EXISTS(p))
3636                        return true;
3637
3638        return false;
3639}
3640
3641static int resolve_copy_blocks_auto_candidate(
3642                dev_t partition_devno,
3643                sd_id128_t partition_type_uuid,
3644                dev_t restrict_devno,
3645                sd_id128_t *ret_uuid) {
3646
3647        _cleanup_(blkid_free_probep) blkid_probe b = NULL;
3648        _cleanup_(sd_device_unrefp) sd_device *dev = NULL;
3649        _cleanup_close_ int fd = -1;
3650        const char *pttype, *t, *p;
3651        sd_id128_t pt_parsed, u;
3652        blkid_partition pp;
3653        dev_t whole_devno;
3654        blkid_partlist pl;
3655        int r;
3656
3657        /* Checks if the specified partition has the specified GPT type UUID, and is located on the specified
3658         * 'restrict_devno' device. The type check is particularly relevant if we have Verity volume which is
3659         * backed by two separate partitions: the data and the hash partitions, and we need to find the right
3660         * one of the two. */
3661
3662        r = block_get_whole_disk(partition_devno, &whole_devno);
3663        if (r < 0)
3664                return log_error_errno(
3665                                r,
3666                                "Unable to determine containing block device of partition %u:%u: %m",
3667                                major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno));
3668
3669        if (restrict_devno != (dev_t) -1 &&
3670            restrict_devno != whole_devno)
3671                return log_error_errno(
3672                                SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EPERM),
3673                                "Partition %u:%u is located outside of block device %u:%u, refusing.",
3674                                major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno),
3675                                major(restrict_devno), minor(restrict_devno));
3676
3677        r = sd_device_new_from_devnum(&dev, 'b', whole_devno);
3678        if (r < 0)
3679                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create sd-device for block device %u:%u: %m",
3680                                       major(whole_devno), minor(whole_devno));
3681
3682        r = sd_device_get_devname(dev, &p);
3683        if (r < 0)
3684                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to get name of block device %u:%u: %m",
3685                                       major(whole_devno), minor(whole_devno));
3686
3687        fd = sd_device_open(dev, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC|O_NONBLOCK);
3688        if (fd < 0)
3689                return log_error_errno(fd, "Failed to open block device %s: %m", p);
3690
3691        b = blkid_new_probe();
3692        if (!b)
3693                return log_oom();
3694
3695        errno = 0;
3696        r = blkid_probe_set_device(b, fd, 0, 0);
3697        if (r != 0)
3698                return log_error_errno(errno_or_else(ENOMEM), "Failed to open block device '%s': %m", p);
3699
3700        (void) blkid_probe_enable_partitions(b, 1);
3701        (void) blkid_probe_set_partitions_flags(b, BLKID_PARTS_ENTRY_DETAILS);
3702
3703        errno = 0;
3704        r = blkid_do_safeprobe(b);
3705        if (IN_SET(r, -2, 1)) { /* nothing found or ambiguous result */
3706                log_debug("Didn't find partition table on block device '%s'.", p);
3707                return false;
3708        }
3709        if (r != 0)
3710                return log_error_errno(errno_or_else(EIO), "Unable to probe for partition table of '%s': %m", p);
3711
3712        (void) blkid_probe_lookup_value(b, "PTTYPE", &pttype, NULL);
3713        if (!streq_ptr(pttype, "gpt")) {
3714                log_debug("Didn't find a GPT partition table on '%s'.", p);
3715                return false;
3716        }
3717
3718        errno = 0;
3719        pl = blkid_probe_get_partitions(b);
3720        if (!pl)
3721                return log_error_errno(errno_or_else(EIO), "Unable read partition table of '%s': %m", p);
3722        errno = 0;
3723
3724        pp = blkid_partlist_devno_to_partition(pl, partition_devno);
3725        if (!pp) {
3726                log_debug("Partition %u:%u has no matching partition table entry on '%s'.",
3727                          major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno), p);
3728                return false;
3729        }
3730
3731        t = blkid_partition_get_type_string(pp);
3732        if (isempty(t)) {
3733                log_debug("Partition %u:%u has no type on '%s'.",
3734                          major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno), p);
3735                return false;
3736        }
3737
3738        r = sd_id128_from_string(t, &pt_parsed);
3739        if (r < 0) {
3740                log_debug_errno(r, "Failed to parse partition type \"%s\": %m", t);
3741                return false;
3742        }
3743
3744        if (!sd_id128_equal(pt_parsed, partition_type_uuid)) {
3745                log_debug("Partition %u:%u has non-matching partition type " SD_ID128_FORMAT_STR " (needed: " SD_ID128_FORMAT_STR "), ignoring.",
3746                          major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno),
3747                          SD_ID128_FORMAT_VAL(pt_parsed), SD_ID128_FORMAT_VAL(partition_type_uuid));
3748                return false;
3749        }
3750
3751        t = blkid_partition_get_uuid(pp);
3752        if (isempty(t)) {
3753                log_debug("Partition %u:%u has no UUID.",
3754                          major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno));
3755                return false;
3756        }
3757
3758        r = sd_id128_from_string(t, &u);
3759        if (r < 0) {
3760                log_debug_errno(r, "Failed to parse partition UUID \"%s\": %m", t);
3761                return false;
3762        }
3763
3764        log_debug("Automatically found partition %u:%u of right type " SD_ID128_FORMAT_STR ".",
3765                  major(partition_devno), minor(partition_devno),
3766                  SD_ID128_FORMAT_VAL(pt_parsed));
3767
3768        if (ret_uuid)
3769                *ret_uuid = u;
3770
3771        return true;
3772}
3773
3774static int find_backing_devno(
3775                const char *path,
3776                const char *root,
3777                dev_t *ret) {
3778
3779        _cleanup_free_ char *resolved = NULL;
3780        int r;
3781
3782        assert(path);
3783
3784        r = chase_symlinks(path, root, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT, &resolved, NULL);
3785        if (r < 0)
3786                return r;
3787
3788        r = path_is_mount_point(resolved, NULL, 0);
3789        if (r < 0)
3790                return r;
3791        if (r == 0) /* Not a mount point, then it's not a partition of its own, let's not automatically use it. */
3792                return -ENOENT;
3793
3794        r = get_block_device(resolved, ret);
3795        if (r < 0)
3796                return r;
3797        if (r == 0) /* Not backed by physical file system, we can't use this */
3798                return -ENOENT;
3799
3800        return 0;
3801}
3802
3803static int resolve_copy_blocks_auto(
3804                sd_id128_t type_uuid,
3805                const char *root,
3806                dev_t restrict_devno,
3807                dev_t *ret_devno,
3808                sd_id128_t *ret_uuid) {
3809
3810        const char *try1 = NULL, *try2 = NULL;
3811        char p[SYS_BLOCK_PATH_MAX("/slaves")];
3812        _cleanup_(closedirp) DIR *d = NULL;
3813        sd_id128_t found_uuid = SD_ID128_NULL;
3814        dev_t devno, found = 0;
3815        int r;
3816
3817        /* Enforce some security restrictions: CopyBlocks=auto should not be an avenue to get outside of the
3818         * --root=/--image= confinement. Specifically, refuse CopyBlocks= in combination with --root= at all,
3819         * and restrict block device references in the --image= case to loopback block device we set up.
3820         *
3821         * restrict_devno contain the dev_t of the loop back device we operate on in case of --image=, and
3822         * thus declares which device (and its partition subdevices) we shall limit access to. If
3823         * restrict_devno is zero no device probing access shall be allowed at all (used for --root=) and if
3824         * it is (dev_t) -1 then free access shall be allowed (if neither switch is used). */
3825
3826        if (restrict_devno == 0)
3827                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EPERM),
3828                                       "Automatic discovery of backing block devices not permitted in --root= mode, refusing.");
3829
3830        /* Handles CopyBlocks=auto, and finds the right source partition to copy from. We look for matching
3831         * partitions in the host, using the appropriate directory as key and ensuring that the partition
3832         * type matches. */
3833
3834        if (gpt_partition_type_is_root(type_uuid))
3835                try1 = "/";
3836        else if (gpt_partition_type_is_usr(type_uuid))
3837                try1 = "/usr/";
3838        else if (gpt_partition_type_is_root_verity(type_uuid))
3839                try1 = "/";
3840        else if (gpt_partition_type_is_usr_verity(type_uuid))
3841                try1 = "/usr/";
3842        else if (sd_id128_equal(type_uuid, GPT_ESP)) {
3843                try1 = "/efi/";
3844                try2 = "/boot/";
3845        } else if (sd_id128_equal(type_uuid, GPT_XBOOTLDR))
3846                try1 = "/boot/";
3847        else
3848                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EOPNOTSUPP),
3849                                       "Partition type " SD_ID128_FORMAT_STR " not supported from automatic source block device discovery.",
3850                                       SD_ID128_FORMAT_VAL(type_uuid));
3851
3852        r = find_backing_devno(try1, root, &devno);
3853        if (r == -ENOENT && try2)
3854                r = find_backing_devno(try2, root, &devno);
3855        if (r < 0)
3856                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to resolve automatic CopyBlocks= path for partition type " SD_ID128_FORMAT_STR ", sorry: %m",
3857                                       SD_ID128_FORMAT_VAL(type_uuid));
3858
3859        xsprintf_sys_block_path(p, "/slaves", devno);
3860        d = opendir(p);
3861        if (d) {
3862                struct dirent *de;
3863
3864                for (;;) {
3865                        _cleanup_free_ char *q = NULL, *t = NULL;
3866                        sd_id128_t u;
3867                        dev_t sl;
3868
3869                        errno = 0;
3870                        de = readdir_no_dot(d);
3871                        if (!de) {
3872                                if (errno != 0)
3873                                        return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to read directory '%s': %m", p);
3874
3875                                break;
3876                        }
3877
3878                        if (!IN_SET(de->d_type, DT_LNK, DT_UNKNOWN))
3879                                continue;
3880
3881                        q = path_join(p, de->d_name, "/dev");
3882                        if (!q)
3883                                return log_oom();
3884
3885                        r = read_one_line_file(q, &t);
3886                        if (r < 0)
3887                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to read %s: %m", q);
3888
3889                        r = parse_devnum(t, &sl);
3890                        if (r < 0) {
3891                                log_debug_errno(r, "Failed to parse %s, ignoring: %m", q);
3892                                continue;
3893                        }
3894                        if (major(sl) == 0) {
3895                                log_debug_errno(r, "Device backing %s is special, ignoring: %m", q);
3896                                continue;
3897                        }
3898
3899                        r = resolve_copy_blocks_auto_candidate(sl, type_uuid, restrict_devno, &u);
3900                        if (r < 0)
3901                                return r;
3902                        if (r > 0) {
3903                                /* We found a matching one! */
3904                                if (found != 0)
3905                                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(ENOTUNIQ),
3906                                                               "Multiple matching partitions found, refusing.");
3907
3908                                found = sl;
3909                                found_uuid = u;
3910                        }
3911                }
3912        } else if (errno != ENOENT)
3913                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed open %s: %m", p);
3914        else {
3915                r = resolve_copy_blocks_auto_candidate(devno, type_uuid, restrict_devno, &found_uuid);
3916                if (r < 0)
3917                        return r;
3918                if (r > 0)
3919                        found = devno;
3920        }
3921
3922        if (found == 0)
3923                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(ENXIO),
3924                                       "Unable to automatically discover suitable partition to copy blocks from.");
3925
3926        if (ret_devno)
3927                *ret_devno = found;
3928
3929        if (ret_uuid)
3930                *ret_uuid = found_uuid;
3931
3932        return 0;
3933}
3934
3935static int context_open_copy_block_paths(
3936                Context *context,
3937                const char *root,
3938                dev_t restrict_devno) {
3939
3940        int r;
3941
3942        assert(context);
3943
3944        LIST_FOREACH(partitions, p, context->partitions) {
3945                _cleanup_close_ int source_fd = -1;
3946                _cleanup_free_ char *opened = NULL;
3947                sd_id128_t uuid = SD_ID128_NULL;
3948                uint64_t size;
3949                struct stat st;
3950
3951                assert(p->copy_blocks_fd < 0);
3952                assert(p->copy_blocks_size == UINT64_MAX);
3953
3954                if (PARTITION_EXISTS(p)) /* Never copy over partitions that already exist! */
3955                        continue;
3956
3957                if (p->copy_blocks_path) {
3958
3959                        source_fd = chase_symlinks_and_open(p->copy_blocks_path, root, CHASE_PREFIX_ROOT, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC|O_NONBLOCK, &opened);
3960                        if (source_fd < 0)
3961                                return log_error_errno(source_fd, "Failed to open '%s': %m", p->copy_blocks_path);
3962
3963                        if (fstat(source_fd, &st) < 0)
3964                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to stat block copy file '%s': %m", opened);
3965
3966                        if (!S_ISREG(st.st_mode) && restrict_devno != (dev_t) -1)
3967                                return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EPERM),
3968                                                       "Copying from block device node is not permitted in --image=/--root= mode, refusing.");
3969
3970                } else if (p->copy_blocks_auto) {
3971                        _cleanup_(sd_device_unrefp) sd_device *dev = NULL;
3972                        const char *devname;
3973                        dev_t devno;
3974
3975                        r = resolve_copy_blocks_auto(p->type_uuid, root, restrict_devno, &devno, &uuid);
3976                        if (r < 0)
3977                                return r;
3978
3979                        r = sd_device_new_from_devnum(&dev, 'b', devno);
3980                        if (r < 0)
3981                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create sd-device object for device %u:%u: %m", major(devno), minor(devno));
3982
3983                        r = sd_device_get_devname(dev, &devname);
3984                        if (r < 0)
3985                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to get device name of %u:%u: %m", major(devno), minor(devno));
3986
3987                        opened = strdup(devname);
3988                        if (!opened)
3989                                return log_oom();
3990
3991                        source_fd = sd_device_open(dev, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC|O_NONBLOCK);
3992                        if (source_fd < 0)
3993                                return log_error_errno(source_fd, "Failed to open automatically determined source block copy device '%s': %m", opened);
3994
3995                        if (fstat(source_fd, &st) < 0)
3996                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to stat block copy file '%s': %m", opened);
3997                } else
3998                        continue;
3999
4000                if (S_ISDIR(st.st_mode)) {
4001                        _cleanup_(sd_device_unrefp) sd_device *dev = NULL;
4002                        const char *bdev;
4003
4004                        /* If the file is a directory, automatically find the backing block device */
4005
4006                        if (major(st.st_dev) != 0)
4007                                r = sd_device_new_from_devnum(&dev, 'b', st.st_dev);
4008                        else {
4009                                dev_t devt;
4010
4011                                /* Special support for btrfs */
4012
4013                                r = btrfs_get_block_device_fd(source_fd, &devt);
4014                                if (r == -EUCLEAN)
4015                                        return btrfs_log_dev_root(LOG_ERR, r, opened);
4016                                if (r < 0)
4017                                        return log_error_errno(r, "Unable to determine backing block device of '%s': %m", opened);
4018
4019                                r = sd_device_new_from_devnum(&dev, 'b', devt);
4020                        }
4021                        if (r < 0)
4022                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to create sd-device object for block device backing '%s': %m", opened);
4023
4024                        r = sd_device_get_devpath(dev, &bdev);
4025                        if (r < 0)
4026                                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to get device name for block device backing '%s': %m", opened);
4027
4028                        safe_close(source_fd);
4029
4030                        source_fd = sd_device_open(dev, O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC|O_NONBLOCK);
4031                        if (source_fd < 0)
4032                                return log_error_errno(source_fd, "Failed to open block device '%s': %m", bdev);
4033
4034                        if (fstat(source_fd, &st) < 0)
4035                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to stat block device '%s': %m", bdev);
4036                }
4037
4038                if (S_ISREG(st.st_mode))
4039                        size = st.st_size;
4040                else if (S_ISBLK(st.st_mode)) {
4041                        if (ioctl(source_fd, BLKGETSIZE64, &size) != 0)
4042                                return log_error_errno(errno, "Failed to determine size of block device to copy from: %m");
4043                } else
4044                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL), "Specified path to copy blocks from '%s' is not a regular file, block device or directory, refusing: %m", opened);
4045
4046                if (size <= 0)
4047                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL), "File to copy bytes from '%s' has zero size, refusing.", opened);
4048                if (size % 512 != 0)
4049                        return log_error_errno(SYNTHETIC_ERRNO(EINVAL), "File to copy bytes from '%s' has size that is not multiple of 512, refusing.", opened);
4050
4051                p->copy_blocks_fd = TAKE_FD(source_fd);
4052                p->copy_blocks_size = size;
4053
4054                free_and_replace(p->copy_blocks_path, opened);
4055
4056                /* When copying from an existing partition copy that partitions UUID if none is configured explicitly */
4057                if (sd_id128_is_null(p->new_uuid) && !sd_id128_is_null(uuid))
4058                        p->new_uuid = uuid;
4059        }
4060
4061        return 0;
4062}

4407static int parse_proc_cmdline_factory_reset(void) {
4408        bool b;
4409        int r;
4410
4411        if (arg_factory_reset >= 0) /* Never override what is specified on the process command line */
4412                return 0;
4413
4414        if (!in_initrd()) /* Never honour kernel command line factory reset request outside of the initrd */
4415                return 0;
4416
4417        r = proc_cmdline_get_bool("systemd.factory_reset", &b);
4418        if (r < 0)
4419                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to parse systemd.factory_reset kernel command line argument: %m");
4420        if (r > 0) {
4421                arg_factory_reset = b;
4422
4423                if (b)
4424                        log_notice("Honouring factory reset requested via kernel command line.");
4425        }
4426
4427        return 0;
4428}

4430static int parse_efi_variable_factory_reset(void) {
4431        _cleanup_free_ char *value = NULL;
4432        int r;
4433
4434        if (arg_factory_reset >= 0) /* Never override what is specified on the process command line */
4435                return 0;
4436
4437        if (!in_initrd()) /* Never honour EFI variable factory reset request outside of the initrd */
4438                return 0;
4439
4440        r = efi_get_variable_string(EFI_SYSTEMD_VARIABLE(FactoryReset), &value);
4441        if (r == -ENOENT || ERRNO_IS_NOT_SUPPORTED(r))
4442                return 0;
4443        if (r < 0)
4444                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to read EFI variable FactoryReset: %m");
4445
4446        r = parse_boolean(value);
4447        if (r < 0)
4448                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to parse EFI variable FactoryReset: %m");
4449
4450        arg_factory_reset = r;
4451        if (r)
4452                log_notice("Factory reset requested via EFI variable FactoryReset.");
4453
4454        return 0;
4455}
4456
4457static int remove_efi_variable_factory_reset(void) {
4458        int r;
4459
4460        r = efi_set_variable(EFI_SYSTEMD_VARIABLE(FactoryReset), NULL, 0);
4461        if (r == -ENOENT || ERRNO_IS_NOT_SUPPORTED(r))
4462                return 0;
4463        if (r < 0)
4464                return log_error_errno(r, "Failed to remove EFI variable FactoryReset: %m");
4465
4466        log_info("Successfully unset EFI variable FactoryReset.");
4467        return 0;
4468}
